Very slick feeling, like it sits on top of the skin. I heard so many people rave about this but it really is not worth the money. Get a tinted moisturizer with SPF instead and it will look/feel better.
My go to SPF! When this spf is applied it is completely invisible and weightless. Easy to apply and the bottle seems to last a long time.

supergoop is known to be super popular and effective so wanted to try it for myself. i see where the comments come from where it seems oily and greasy. i wouldn’t say it has a great texture but definitely can give off an oily look on the face, but i personally found it to be more natural and dewy bare face. something to note is due to the formulation, it can make you sweat more and/or make your face feel more warm/hot since it is changing the rays into heat on your face. it does work well with primers that end with a tacky feeling, like the Milk Grip Primer, for better sticking foundation. i wouldn’t recommend primers and foundations-Kosas Oil-that are too watery/thin, though.
Best sunscreen ever! It gives me a matte like finish the consistency is like a gel and it’s clear I have oily skin and it doesn’t make me oily at all it’s perfect
I love this sunscreen, doesn’t leave a white cast. Haven’t used a diff sunscreen since
Very nice sunscreen, no white cast, it does have a silicone primer feel but I find that it layers well with makeup.

I have skin that usually is prone to breakouts when it comes to stuff like this. So I was weary. But, recently I started becoming sensitive to the sun. I get noticeable itchy red rashes with little bumps on my face. I bought the mini size of this sunscreen and will be buying the full size when I run out. My skin looks a lot healthier and I haven’t gotten the red bumps ever since. Solved a problem that not even my prescribed medication could get rid of.
I absolutely love this SPF. No white cast, not too heavy, not oily, and no scent. My skin had not reacted negatively to it and I have been using for months

I love this product!!! I have previously gone to the dermatologist for rosacea and malasma and they suggested another product that I like, however, it was too heavy for everyday wear. I work outside in the Florida heat and I would avoid using sunscreen because I felt as if my face was suffocating under it. Every sunscreen I tried just felt too thick and irritated my eyes. Not this…I will never switch and I highly recommend.
It feels good when you put it on at first. But soon it becomes oily on the face.
This is amazing product which I was looking for a long time.
Best sunscreen I have ever tried , I also use it as a primer

I really wanted to love this product but it really just doesn't work. I liked the way this formula felt after trying it in the store with the help from an employee who showed me all the Supergoop sunscreens, but when I wore it to work (outdoor/indoor environment) and my face was burnt to a crisp after non-intensive, pretty regular use. If you actually plan on reappling every 40 minutes (soooo short) then this may work for you, but for a person on the move, don't even try this, absolutely not worth it.
reviews.review_title: Really just not a reliable product

reviews.review_text: Didn’t work for me. Got badly burnt using this. Not something I would recommend. It is a primer and nothing else, no sun protection at all.
Works really well under makeup and I have not had a sunburn on my face since using this! No white cast. Can make me get oily faster but that’s ok! Does not make me break out.

Meh. . . not impressed.  Soley a personal preference. I actually like a dewey look and this is like a primer. Reminds me of PhotoFinish/SmashBox, but a bit thicker.  I think some may like the feel, but really wasn't what I was expecting after so many raving reviews.  I'll stick to Black Girl Sunscreen.
I love this product and will be buying again. It’s lightweight yet moisturizing. I mix with my vitamin C serum and wear alone or as a makeup primer.
Yes this product is very light and velvety, but I noticed  no difference with  this or using a light bb cream spf. So save your $$ and get something cheaper.
Holy Grail!! Scent, texture, ease… smooths our skin, lovely on its own. Feel moisturized after use. Will not run out of this ever!! Sensitive skin approved!
Love this stuff so much...this is my first time buying anything from Supergoop and I am in love with this product. The coverage on this one is so amazing. Will be buying more in the future.

Breakouts in literally 30 minutes. Literally skin started purging! I tried using this product multiple times after purchase. I gave it multiple chances and every time I started using, the same day I had breakouts. Not a good product AT ALL.
Absolutely love! Great primer-like texture for under makeup or on it’s own. Paired with other Supergoop products (under eye), my summer routine got so much easier!

i’ve tested probably about a dozen sunscreens trying to find the right one for me and i thought i’d finally found THE one but sadly, i was wrong. i saw this sunscreen getting a lot of hype over the past year and i was finally able to get my hands on a small sample from the rewards bazaar. right away, it was everything i wanted in a sunscreen: invisible, easy to apply & non-greasy! however after wearing it throughout the day, i noticed a couple new breakouts at night that i can only believe were caused by this product. i’m extremely upset at my skin for betraying me like this because this means i’ll have to go back to sporting a greasy ghost face from my mineral sunscreens. oh well, maybe in another life unseen sunscreen :(
reviews.review_title: incredibly jealous of ppl who can use this!

reviews.review_text: i love it! the consistency feels a lot like a primer. Also sensitive skin check, no break outs after any of my uses. Posted a pic where I used it as well.
reviews.review_title: Good, and works for sensitive skin!

reviews.review_text: Love this!! Got the mini to try, and i will be purchasing the full size!! The gel consistency is great. It doesnt feel too thick, it feels just right.

I use this as my daily sunscreen under my makeup and let me tell you i was nervous at first. The consistency of it will make you think it’s going to be greasy, and cause your makeup to be blotchy. Wrong. This stuff is solid and if anything helps my face look smoother and hides my pores. Great product. I’ve tried other sunscreens under makeup and this one by far is the best option.
Best primer!!! You’re skin feels so soft and looks like porcelain. Makeup applies easily over it. Great amount of sunscreen as well! Definitely worth the money in my opinion.
Perfect. This is my new favorite sunscreen for face. Works alone or as a primer under makeup. I tried several types of supergoop and this is the best.

I am in love with this sunscreen! I am a Latina woman and was struggling to find a sunscreen that did not leave a white cast, didn't smell disgusting, and that felt light enough on my face. This is the ONE! I am willing to repurchase this time and time again because I know it works for me so I think it is worth the money. It is so easy to apply and the gel consistency is really light! I LOVE LOVE LOVE this sunscreen!
It has the texture of a mattifying primer and works well under makeup. However since I don't wear foundation every day and have dry skin, it's not a great every day option for me.

This stuff is the real deal. I have tried 6 different really high quality face sunscreens (including eltaMD, La Roche Posay, Shiseido to name a few) for use at the beach or at the pool and this is THE ONLY ONE that did not irritate my skin upon being doused with chlorine pool water, or salt water, or being reapplied multiple times in between those swim sessions! I cannot say enough good things about this sunscreen. I have very fair skin and burn easily and I got no burns while in the sun all day in Costa Rica. The finish is super surprising for a sunscreen. To me it feels exactly like a primer. Very dry to the touch. It goes on like a dream bad leaves no white cast or weird shine. I would wear it every day if it weren’t so expensive so I stick to my cheaper everyday sunscreen that isn’t waterproof and save this for when I need water resistance. I am really sensitive to mineral sunscreens so if you’re like me I would trust the chemical filters supergoop has put in this product. It is fantastic. I will never use another face sunscreen for wet hot summer days! Thanks supergoop.
reviews.review_title: PERFECT face SPF to swim and sweat in

reviews.review_text: Love this stuff! It truly is invisible, effective and non-irritating! Works well alone or under makeup. Super Goop is my go-to line of sunscreens.

My new everyday face sunscreen. Formula goes on seamlessly and dries quickly. A little product goes a long way. Small size is perfect for a two week  beach vacation, with plenty of product to spare if you on more than just your face.

I love this sunscreen so much. I tried other super goop sunscreens but this one is my favorite for oily skin. I work all day outdoors and this is the best product for reapplying too. It is definitely pricey. The only downside is that it's does pill over other products, but I have yet to find a sunscreen that doesn't to be honest. The texture is also like a primer not a lotion.
Feels really rubbery and exactly like silicone. Definitely made for people who wear makeup as this feels like a primer

Ill give it a 0 star. Just started using it. $34 for this cheap material that is broken after 1 week of use. I never ever had this kind of problem with any other product which has similar packaging. I am ao upset that i wasted my money on this cant wven use it because it leaked in a bag

This is not like any sunscreen I have ever used before. It protects your skin from the sun, but doesn’t make you look greasy or oily. It doesn’t add anything. It just looks great. It’s expensive, but honestly worth it.

Love this sunscreen as my final skincare step before applying makeup. There's no white cast but it does have a slight sunscreen smell (which I like, but fades quickly and isn't overwhelming). The Unseen Sunscreen does have a thick gel silicone-y feel to it, so if you don't like that in a makeup primer, you may not want to wear it under makeup. I've found it to work well with both powder foundations (Bare Minerals) and a sheer skin tint formula (Chanel Water Fresh Tint). Took off one star because over time the sunscreen did seem to get a little liquified and a bit gritty but it doesn't seem to have affected the sun protection or wear.
reviews.review_title: Great for everyday wear under makeup

reviews.review_text: LOVE this!! its lightweight, actually invisible- no white residue.  And it works so well with the other products in my skincare routine.  I love that it gives a slight matting effect (at least it does for me).  It feels good on my skin and a little goes a long way- definetly a staple in my routine.
reviews.review_title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE just buy it!

reviews.review_text: This is my go to sunscreen. It sits well under makeup and doesn’t leave a white cast. I have medium tan skin tone . My skin is also acne prone and oily . I love this because it acts as a primer as well so I can put my makeup on top and it stays on all day. The only issue I have is that sometimes it pills on the lower half of my face.

The only sunscreen I use and recommend. I have combo/sensitive skin. The moment I put something on my face that will cause irritation, I know within seconds. This doesn’t burn, no crazy smells, and goes great with or without makeup! I also love the matte-blurring effect :-)
Thought this was a lotion sunscreen and it instead has a heavy gel-like texture.
Love this sunscreen! And primer! I’d buy it again. Very very smooth and no eye sting.
Love this sunscreen for my oily skin. Feels like a primer. Makes my makeup go on even better. I bought it to use while at the beach. Now I use it daily. Will repurchase.

I'm not sure what I was expecting with the texture, but it certainly was not a silicone primer-like texture. If worn alone, this stuff is okay texture-wise. But I find it doesn't play well with other products. It pills up with some moisturizers and some foundations I've tried it with. Even letting my moisturizer sit for 10-15 before applying it and then letting the sunscreen sit for additional time before makeup.

Sooo good! Doesn’t leave a white cast (obviously lol), feels so good it’s sunscreen but feels like a makeup primer. Leaves my skin matte and soft. Makeup applies so good on it, it’s Literally amazing. Bought the smaller version first and had to get the full size.
reviews.review_title: my favorite sunscreen ever! worth the $$$

reviews.review_text: This is the best sunscreen I have ever used and i care a lot about sunscreen. 1. It fully protects you skin from sun. 2. It makes your skin look amazing, improving compliance of using it. 3. It has a very nice texture, like a silky gel. 4. It lasts way longer than you’d think. I’ve repurchased this time and time again and I always have an extra bottle on hand if I need. Will literally talk about this product at parties, that’s how good it is.

This sunscreen is very lightweight and feels like a silicone primer. My only complaint is I feel like it works best under makeup and is not great for no makeup days. It just feels a little slippery on my skin and it doesn’t really sink in if I don’t set it with powder on top.

Absolutely love this sunscreen!! Living in LA, I am someone that applies sunscreen daily.  In the past I have always used creamy texture for coverage, but this goop has a gel texture and the coverage I feel is better!! No white streaks and absorbs into my skin very quickly. Its very light, which is great as I am an oily skin gal :)

This sunscreen goes on so smooth feels so good.  I can't even tell I have it on, plus it doesn't have that sunscreen smell.  I really enjoy using it.  It hasn't caused me to break out either even with sensitive skin.
no cast at all!! truly invisible and works with sensitive skin i just can’t stand the smell
My favorite face sunscreen ever! It’s light and has like primer texture and consistency. It’s blurring and matifying too.
Best sunscreen hands down!  Feels just like a primer, soft and silky.

I have struggle for many years to find a sunscreen that would not cause breakouts. This one is the only sunscreen that has been effective and not caused breakouts. It is a gel consistency, but doesn't feel sticky when applied. it's like the Smashbox primer, feels like a powder. Honestly, I can't even explain it. 
Anyway, I have combo skin, and my t-zone can be oily, this does not make my face oily. If anything, it balances out my skin and keeps my t-zone from becoming oily. I initially ordered the mini size and I am now purchasing the regular size. I truly enjoy this product and am so happy I finally found something that doesn't cause break outs.

This is my #1 must have. I work as a mail carrier, so I am out in the sun most of the day. I HATE using sunscreen because it either leaves a white cast, pills up, or leaves my face feeling tight. Supergoop is the only suncreen I have found that doesn't do ANY of those things! It glides on, you only need a small amount, it's clear and makes my face feel like velvet. I love it and will always have it in my arsenal to use daily.

I wanted to love this so much. Like every other person on earth I'm constantly searching for that perfect SPF that doesn't make me look like someone wiped a greasy slice of pizza on my face. This isn't it though :( YES this sunscreen is clear -- so if white cast is your #1 concern, you will love this! I can see how folks with a darker complexion would love this because it is absolutely clear. I, however, am the palest person you've ever seen, have a very oily t-zone, prone to breakouts, have sensitive skin, and while I don't want white cast, I REALLY don't want to look or feel greasy. My main priorities are A) the SPF being effective and B) non-greasy, non-heavy. I give this 3 stars because it is definitely effective SPF, kept me burn-free. But it looks greasy on my skin immediately and feels sticky and gross like any other sunscreen. I found myself just returning to my other drugstore sunscreens. So for me it's just fine and works like any other cheaper brand. Sigh.

Perfectly lightweight sunscreen that goes on clear. Seems to last a long time and doesn’t pill when reapplying. Packing and amount of product can be a little frustrating 

PROS:
- completely clear and fragrance free
- glides onto skin easily like a gel
- broad-spectrum claims seems to hold up irl

CONS:
- It’s completely clear so it’s difficult to tell if you’ve covered your face completely (a slight tint would be nice)
- tube is a standard squeeze bottle and it’s difficult to get the last bits out unless you cut it open near the bottom
- can feel a tad oily to the touch if you don’t rub it in pretty hard

I thought this sunscreen was pilling at first but discovered it was my moisturizer that was causing it. I tried a few other moisturizers and had no problem with pilling.

Best sunscreen ever! Been using this sunscreen for years and I highly recommend this for my fellow Black and brown girls who have had to deal with white-cast from sunscreens in the past. This formula is completely invisible!
I love this sunscreen! It keeps my face from burning. And is easy to reapply on super hot Florida beach days!

silicone texture but soaked in well (i have dry skin).  the trouble was, i burned.  i used it, burned, and thought maybe i didn't re-apply frequently enough.  used it again, was militant about reapplication, and burned again.  this is a SPF40, and i used a different brand in SPF45 on my face and they were night and day.  no way 5 clicks more spf would create such a disparity in sun protection.  i don't think it protects well at all.

I cannot give this product enough praise. I have incredibly sensitive skin when it comes to sunscreen. Even showing my face the tube causes my eyes to burn and eczema to flare up around my mouth. So much so I often skip it. This summer instead of blowing through my pricey Bare Minerals for every day wear around the house which has spf...I decided to try tomorrow moisturizer with spf. I tried Ulta brand and it felt so heavy like I may as well have been wearing foundations plus it caused deep breakouts that took weeks to clear up. No bueno. I than moved onto pricey drug store products. Cera Ve daily face moisturizer with spf, Vichy, etc. I still needed to use my regular moisturizer underneath. Cera be felt OK but overwhelming typical sunscreen smell AND my face still felt sticky and weighted down and started having to research no-wash options for quickly cleaning my face at the end of the day to remove it, without having to go through my whole face washing routine. 

Then I found this while browsing at Sephora. I was looking at Shiseido and as always overwhelming with my options. I fell in love with this right then and there in the store after trying it on. 

I literally wear it every day. I put it on after my morning routine and know if I step outside for a walk at lunch I'm good plus what a difference it's made in helping set my eyes for the day!

I can't feel it. My skin doesn't notice it T ALL!! I haven't broken out once because of this which every other spf whether for sensitive skin, non-comodogenic, etc always do. 

I don't even feel like I need to wash my face after putting this on and it does not bother my eczema. It doesn't smell like sunscreen at all instead I find the smell, what little there is, to be very refreshing. To me (and again it's unscented but a slight product smell) it reminds me of pool water which only enhances to experience for me as I love that smell. 

So far it works because I have spent lots of time out in the sun and no color at all.
reviews.review_title: The holy grail of SPF for ppl who hate sunscreen

reviews.review_text: I am not sure if Sephora blocked me for writing 1 or 2 star reviews for Supergoop...?! I had to return this because I was not told by the sales associate that this is chemical sunscreen. I prefer mineral based products. I am bummed out because I used 500 points to get $10 my purchase and now can't them back.... These days it is no fun shopping in-store because the loud music, crowded space and most customers not wearing a mask. I wanted to get out of there so fast and didn't bother reading the ingredients. So this may be a great sunscreen but not for me.

I have used other Supergoop! sunscreens and had no issues. Sadly, this formula caused repeated breakouts. I know it’s this sunscreen as this was what I added into the daily routine. Breakouts stopped after I stopped using this. 

I tried to return to Sephora but it was past their 60-day return policy. Lesson learned to buy what you need and not stock up and take advantage of the sale.

This sunscreen is amazing. The texture is like butter, but not oily. It's a great makeup primer, but is also great by itself and the best sunscreen for reapplying multiple times per day (not on top of makeup thought). This is completely clear and has NO white cast. It would be perfect for any skin type.

The Unseen Sunscreen is my favorite SPF. Supergoop as a whole has all of my favorite SPF's as well. This one specifically has a silicone feel, which I love! It also feels great as a primer under makeup
I strongly disliked this sunscreen, it feels very silicone like and slippery on the skin. I do think it works as far as protecting the skin, it just has a strange texture.
This is probably one of the best sunscreens out there that I have tried so far! I love how it doesn’t leave a white residue and blends into the skin effortlessly

best sunscreen I have ever used. I love the smell as it reminds of the beach. It absorbs very easily and do not make you look white. It is so easy to use it for everyday and I became a SPF believer after thus. I wish it was a bit lower cost but It is what it is.
reviews.review_title: best sunscreen ever and smells so so good

reviews.review_text: I used this on a trip to Jaimaca. It is not greasy, gives good coverage, and did not cause my oily skin to break out.
Love love love! It is truly unseen and it’s not smelly. That’s always been my big issue is the smell of sunscreen. A little goes a long way with this which really makes it worth the price.

I was intrigued by this product because it is clear and it claims to work well under makeup. I immediately loved the application because it was silky and left no smell or white cast. I wore it to the beach and reapplied it 4 times over 4 hours. I have never gotten such bad sunburn in my entire life, and im somebody who is in the sun all the time. My whole face is a scab. Im not saying this is a bad product for under makeup, but i dont think that it offers good sun protection.
reviews.review_title: did not work as an spf

reviews.review_text: Tube ripped at the top so every time I squeeze it, it comes out of two places. I tried to exchange it. I was told I couldn't because it's been over the return time. I live an hour away from a Sephora. Going to think twice about purchasing from Sephora again.

This sunscreen is the BEST. It doesn’t feel like a sunscreen, more like a facial primer. When it’s applied, it is truly unseen and is neither greasy or white like typical sunscreen. You cannot see this sunscreen when you put it on, yet it protects your skin from the sun! perfect for layering under makeup too

I’ve been looking for a sunscreen that doesn’t sting when I reapply, doesn’t pill under makeup, feels great on my skin, and doesn’t make me break out. I found it in this!! I would give it 5 stars if it wasn’t so expensive. Despite the price this is my new go to!

I like this product, and I would consider purchasing again. I like the result on my face but I will say I don’t think it layers well under or over make up. I find myself grabbing this when I don’t want to use foundation. I also don’t think it adds any coverage if you’re looking for that. But the glow is nice.
reviews.review_title: Good glow, not for under make up

reviews.review_text: Love it! My makeup goes on so well after applying this. I have dry skin.

I have ordered so many of these so that I could keep in various places and keep reapplying as recommended while in the Bahamas and I didn't burn! I tried it out before vacation and loved how easily it applies and how quickly it dries down. While on vacation if my face got wet I could feel it sting my eyes a little but I don't think this product claims to be waterproof so I won't hold it against them. I also noticed... this is a really good makeup primer! I never knew how much difference a good primer could be until I decided to do makeup over this sunscreen and everything applied so much more evenly. I got married in the middle of the afternoon in July and just used this as the base for my makeup that I did myself. I didn't reapply because reception was inside but the makeup held perfectly all night.
My go-to matte sunscreen for everyday use. Great under makeup

I've been searching for a sunscreen (for my face) for a long time. I have sensitive skin and a slight case of rosacea. I've been using this for a week now and it is so silky and beautiful. I love it especially because it's a primer before my makeup!

This is the best sunscreen I have ever used.  It goes on velvety soft and is truly invisible.  It even cut down on the shine left by my moisturizer underneath!  I would give this a perfect 5 stars if only it came in a bigger size for this price.
reviews.review_title: Best sunscreen I have ever used

reviews.review_text: This is my most repurchased sunscreen because it really is invisible and you forget you area wearing it. Reapplication is seamless as well even over my bare minerals complexion rescue tinted moisturizer. I have sensitive skin and this is the only sunscreen that hasn’t irritated my eyes.
Love this stuff!  Feels so light on my skin. I keep it out of the family sunscreen drawer, since I don’t want to share it!

I’m African American with a dark hue. I visited the dermatologist for hyperpigmentation and she recommended that I use this in conjunction with a compound that was prescribed. I expressed my concerns about sunscreens (cast that they leave on my skin AND that purple effect). She mentioned that this doesn’t do that. So I took the plunge and do not regret it. It goes on clear and doesn’t weigh my skin down. I wear light makeup and that is not affected. This doesn’t have a shine however it is not a matte finish. Black women, you will not be disappointed. My one regret; I wish this came in a larger size.
This sunscreen is true to it’s name. One of my biggest concerns about sunscreen is how it looks on my skin, and I don’t have to worry about that with Unseen Sunscreen. I’d buy this again and again.
My go to for face sunscreen on vacation.  It really works!

I bought a 15ml to try out this product. It worked out fine until I had 2 days of continuous sun exposure recently. I was out and about under the sun for 3-4 hours with physical coverage (sunglasses, hat). I also reapplied the sunscreen in between. 

However, on both days, I came home with my face red. Luckily, no burn on my face. But I applied rescue masks just in case. And I stopped using this product and switched back to an old-school zinc based one. 

Do not recommend.
Did not protect from the sun. Even after applying enough of it and reapplying often both my husband and I got sunburnt while on vacation. One Star because the texture is very nice.

I used to only use Korean sunscreens, but due to all the scandal around them, I’ve had to find other sunscreens. I have oily, acne prone, sensitive skin, so it was really hard for me to find a sunscreen that I liked…until I stumbled upon this one! I love the texture of the sunscreen and the way it makes my skin feels, it kinda feels like a primer, and it doesn’t make my face oily after applying, kinda makes it dewey. It’s clear so it doesn’t leave any cast, so overall amazing! Would like it more if it was cheaper tho.

I know people love this product, but it was just too thick for me. If you have sensitive skin or can’t handle thicker products, I would not recommend. Smells great and and oily, though. I’m sure it’s great for other types of skin!

So, it works. It is super lightweight.
It protects from the sun.

I went on a hike for 3 hours in 90 degrees that was all sun and this was the result. My face was a-ok. 

Always feel light weight. Glides on super easy. No white cast, and never makes my skin feel greasy. 

My hike photo
reviews.review_title: Saved my face, but I didn’t put any on my chest

reviews.review_text: I previously used the Neutrogena facial sunscreen, but didn’t like the cast/residue texture it left behind. Especially when I would put on foundation, it would make it flake off. I recently bought this sunscreen and have been so impressed! After I rub it into my skin it feels and look invisible! And it looks great with makeup also. I wish it wasn’t super pricey, but has been the best sunscreen I’ve tried so far.
Horrible, my skin has broken out so badly the day after wearing this, feels oily on skin, definitely don’t recommend for naturally oily skin
reviews.review_title: broke me out, red bumps and whiteheads everywhere

reviews.review_text: I love how this feels and is completely invisible!

Absolutely love this sunscreen. I have combo skin and it definitely helps mattify it and makes my skin feel like a baby’s bottom. It’s pricey, but worth it to not look like an oil slick and to be protected from the sun! Will definitely be purchasing for the long haul.

I’ve tried them all and I keep coming back to this one! This sunscreen has great ingredients and doesn’t leave my face looking oily! Also works great as a primer for those days when I decided to wear makeup.

A blogger recommended this product and I bought it and I LOVE IT 
It doesn’t leave white cast on my Indian skin which is AMAZING. And it does it’s sunscreen job the way it’s supposed to. My make up also lays well on this. I wish it was less expensive lol
I like the texture, truly unseen, easy to apply, veyr lightweight.  I wish it could be cheaper.
I'm in love with this product! It makes a great stand alone or goes well under makeup.

I have oily, olive toned skin and this sunscreen is amazing! Iive in the humid south and this has been the only sunscreen to workout for me. No white cast, doesn't burn your eyes, and doesn't look greasy when applying. I usually get oily throughout the day, but I don't have to powder it down unless I've been sweating. One con is the price

this product was horrid for my combo skin. it just sits on top of the surface and gets more oily as you apply throughout the day. this product is also comedogenic so you may want to steer clear if you have acne. it would make my face red instantly and inflame any active acne or scarring. it also made my makeup melt right off and offered no priming qualities even though that is what it’s marketed as.
Love this product, super smooth to apply and no awful sunscreen smell. Does not change your moisturizing routine, it elevates it!

I've tried a lot of facial sunscreens, and Supergoop is by far the best one. It's light weight, goes on smoothly, and doesn't leave feel sticky or greasy even in the hottest weather. And because it's clear, I don't have to worry about it leaving a white, chalky, mask-like film on my face.
reviews.review_title: I've finally found a facial sunscreen

reviews.review_text: I’ll be honest, I expected it to be little but I did NOT expect it to be this tiny...and it peels off my face after a while, this tiny bottle is NOT! Worth 20$, it’s worth 5 dollars or maybe less, this is probably gonna last me a week and a half, probably not even that...

Before recently I never wore sunscreen regularly. Once I found out that you should, I began my search for something that would work good. I went to my local Sephora and they had me try this, and oh my gosh, you can’t even tell I’m wearing it. Definitely recommend!

This is my secret weapon. I moved from the high desert to the seaside subtropics, and this sunscreen is my go-to. 

This new weather brought back teenage-level oiliness in my skin, and the unseen sunscreen blurs blemishes without clogging pores. The SPF is strong, I haven’t freckled while using it. It wears great under makeup, I use it with RMS and Hourglass. It has no color. 

This is my number one recommendation to anyone looking for face sunscreen, the primer/blurring effect is amazing.
Obsessed with this sunscreen! It’s so lightweight and sheer that you don’t even feel like you have anything on, but it works great!
This sunscreen brought me into daily wear. It’s texture is smooth and it is perfect to wear under makeup or on its own. Highly recommend!

Loving this product on my skin it’s clear and easy to reapply and is smooth under my makeup similar to a primer almost also has a good hydrating effect. It’s very light and spreads easily so I don’t need a lot at once

I have tried a lot of them over the years - but this is the holy grail of sunscreen. I have combination skin. Tends to be more oily in the summer and drier in the winter. I love this sunscreen so much! The texture and feel of it is so unique. Goes on like a Smashbox primer. Does not leave any greasy residue or white sheen - it's totally clear. The only negative thing I would say is that it is rather expensive for a small size, but to me it is 100% worth it.
reviews.review_title: The only sunscreen I will use!

reviews.review_text: If you want to wear this under foundation you have to make sure your foundation is silicone based. This sunscreen is a silicone based product. If you put a water based foundation on top, it will pill up! I use NARS sheer glow foundation. It is silicone based, so it is compatible with this product and works wonderfully on top of it. Make sure your product bases match! This general rule goes for every primer and foundation btw.

I bought Glow, Matte, and Unseen sunscreens for comparison and ended up loving them all. This goes on so smooth it feels like a primer — a looks like it too, you really can’t see it. It’s a sunscreen I actually don’t mind using every day!

Really wanted to love this product, but my skin didn’t agree with it. The texture is similar to a silicone primer. The scent is a cross between sunscreen and silicone primer. I could feel it sitting on top of my skin with i didn’t mind too much. It goes on completely clear which I loved, but sadly, it made me break out and have dry patches. I ended up giving it to my sister, and she hasn’t had any issues with her skin reacting poorly. Just didn’t work out for me :(
Good on hot summer days when my normal skin type is more oily and I want sun protection under makeup!
I’ve tried dozens of sunscreens and this one really holds up!!! The only thing I wish for is that the SPF was a bit higher, but that just being extra. This sunscreen is LIT
reviews.review_title: Lit sunscreen keeps your face dim

reviews.review_text: It’s not a bad product, but for the price I feel there are significantly better options. The texture of the product feels greasy on your fingertips but has a smooth application. It did not pair well with my regular products, and left a bit of a tacky residue. I only attempted to apply makeup over it once and everything balled up so much I washed my entire face and started all over again, applying the scant remains of my go to sunscreen. I regularly use glow recipe for skin care and a mix of urban decay, Fenty, and Benefit makeup for reference.
Fantastic as a primer, fantastic as a sunscreen.  Feels like Smash Photofinish primer, same silky texture.
love this! exactly as advertised: weightless, colorless, scentless, oil-free formula for face that leaves behind a velvety soft finish; also acts as a makeup-gripping primer
Love this!  My husband and I use it every day.  Lightweight and smooth. Seems to give good sun protection.  Have repurchased several times.
Not a fan. This sunscreen felt way too silicone-y for me, and I had problems with my makeup being patchy over top.

I tried asking and then answering a question in response to someone wondering why this is classified as Clean at Sephora. I don't know why this is classified as clean, or why tons of products on Sephora are, but the top ingredients in this sunscreen are Avobenzone, Homosalate, Octisalate, and Octocrylene. Those are all concerning to health. My guess is this review will get deleted, but for what it's worth, this isn't a particularly clean or safe product. Just check out any peer reviewed science journal on sunscreen (Matta, 2020; Hayden, 2005; etc.)
I LOVE this product!  Completely translucent and feels just like a good primer!

Does it work as sunscreen? Yes. Does it feel good applying and during wear? Absolutely not. It feels so much like silicone I can’t help but hate it. It reminds me a bit too much of the pore filling primer texture. It leaves my skin feeling oily even though it’s not.
I’m obsessed. Has never broken me out and doesn’t make me look dry when I wear it. Don’t even think about it just buy it!!!

I think i had my hopes a little high on this one. I did get a pretty bad sunburn and figured it was because i didn’t use enough. The next time i used way more and still got burnt and it ran into my eyes. I was glad i got the mini to try it out.

the formula of this sunscreen is amazing. it soaks into the skin well, it’s slightly hydrating, and as the name suggests, you can’t tell it’s on your face besides the nice glow you’re left with. however, the smell is unbearable to me. i don’t know if i got a bad batch, but it gives me a headache and the smell lingers. if it didn’t hurt to smell it i would repurchase. it’s a good sunscreen, but not that good if you’re sensitive to scents.
Really like the texture, but as soon as I put my makeup on top of this it just starts rubbing/peeling off. Can only use this if not wearing any makeup
I LOVE this product!  Completely translucent and feels just like a good primer!
Silky-matte protection, this product keeps my sensitive skin happy and my makeup in place. Best sunblock I’ve tried.

Chemical filter sunscreen that goes on clear with a semi-matte finish. I wasn’t sure about the silicone at first because of previous primer pilling experiences but this product pleasantly surprised me! No pilling under tinted moisturizer or medium coverage foundation, and no oily finish or strong scent like other sunscreens I’d used. One star deduction because the overall and per ounce price are too high for my regular use (especially with 1/4 tsp initial application and reapplying throughout the day - the mini size lasted only a couple weeks) but did enjoy using this while it lasted.

This is a product I will buy over and over again. It’s one of the best primers I’ve ever used and it’s a bonus with the spf 40!  I’m quite light and my face burns easily, and I don’t want to get early wrinkles due to the sun, so I make sure I always have sunscreen on my face. If I use a foundation that has sunscreen I still make sure to put on another one, which makes this product so awesome bc I save a step. Throughout the day I make sure to spritz my face with Supergoop’s Defense Spray as well. Anyway, you won’t be disappointed with this product.

This was my summer go to sunscreen but recently it’s caused my skin to break out terribly. I usually have clear smooth skin but after a week of eliminating products I found this was the culprit. I also sun burned despite wearing it. It does nothing but create a worse situation for your skin.
i love the way it feels on my skin. It barely has a smell which i love! it doesnt smell like sunscreen.

I normally do not write any review's but this product really deserves 1. I have been using it since over a month now and it has been wonderful. It's non greasy and still leaves a shine on your face. Perfect for a darker skin and does not leave a white cast behind. I break out easily and very few products work for my skin.. This is definitely one of those!!

The best sunscreen and primer! I would never go back to another sunscreen or primer after experiencing this one. I have a very sensitive skin and I’ve had no negative reaction to this product. Highly recommended, try it yourself.

This is expensive but worth it. I have tried so many others and they either are too sticky, pill or have white cast. This leaves a really nice natural finish and it does not pill on me!! It’s not drying to my dry skin but it isn’t moisturizing. I might need to try something else for winter but for spring and summer, it’s perfect. It really is a primer. 

I have tried so many cheaper options and they are horrible compared this. I will continue to repurchase. I bought the limited edition larger size and a normal size bottle. It is a really fluffy formula so you will fly through it, at least I do. So it’s really expensive but worth it.

I wish I could give this product 3.5 stars. I received a sample of this with an order and didn’t try it right away because I tried the SuperScreen and didn’t like it. The other day, I was like let me see what it is about. Wow, loved the texture, like a gel but not sticky, and it went on absolutely CLEAR. I typically prefer mineral sunscreens, but having brown skin, this was a plus for me.  It did leave a film on my face, but when I touched my skin my finger wasn’t oily. I stayed inside most of the morning and I could still feel the film. Once I went outside, I feel like the sunscreen almost dried up if you will and I didn’t feel as protected which is why I only gave it 3 stars. My skin didn’t burn or anything, but I kind of felt like the sunscreen disappeared. Never had that feeling with a mineral sunscreen unless I was really sweating or swimming.  It might be a sunscreen I would use in the winter when the sun isn’t as intense as now in the summer.  Going to try the Sheer Screen so I hope that works better for me. This one could be a good try if you like chemical sunscreens and want a clear finish.
reviews.review_title: Goes on clear and nice texture

reviews.review_text: I bought this to avoid the white cast that some sunscreens have. This is transparent, odorless, and has a nice smooth application. It has silicone in it (Dimethicone), which I have no problem with other than it makes it a little prone to causing my makeup to pill. But it's not terrible, and if you give it some dry-down time (.5 hr for me in a humid environment) it can help avoid that. I'd probably buy again.

I’ve been loyal to Tizo3 and EltaMD (found in dermatologist offices or Amazon) sunscreens for the last decade, but am now a Supergoop fan! Over the last several months, retinoid and prescription strength hormonal acne medication has seriously irritated and dried out my skin. This sunscreen delivers everything I need as it is highly moisturizing and soothing due to the frankincense and meadowfoam seed. The formula goes on clear, scentless, is velvety soft, and truly doubles as a make up primer! It held up my make up while moisturizing my skin in dry and hot Las Vegas summer weather. My only gripe is that when applying the recommended amount of daily sunscreen, or the 2 finger rule, it does feel like a lot on your face - therefore not weightless as it claims to be. For that reason, I’m also not sure how oily skin types will do if you’re applying the correct amount of sunscreen daily. Nonetheless, I love this formula!

Beat sunscreen I've ever used. And this is as someone who has hated sunscreen my whole life, has tan skin that always shows the white/gray cast from sunscreen. I have tried very expensive sunscreen brands that made my skin breakout, sting, and burn upon application. Unseen Screen is lightweight, melts into my skin, acts like a nice primer when I'm wearing makeup, doesn't pill or sink into lines. I feel like I'm not wearing anything at all.
Supergoop! goes on smooth and helps keep my makeup on. Very effective and highly recommended!

This really is invisible and feels exactly like my Bare Minerals primer...slippery and almost dry and disappears right away. Didn’t irritate my skin like some chemical sunscreen, and I didn’t have to apply a giant glob...they recommend a dime-sized amount which seems just right. Absolutely love it and glad I decided to give it a try.

I purchased this in March and it’s barely starting run out, and I wear sunscreen every day. Of course I wish it came with more ounces for the price but still a decent amount. It melts into your face. It almost has the texture of those silicone-y primers. I personally love it.

What I purchased was fine. I bot it. 
I didn’t get my free samples, again

I am a big fan of the Supergoop brand and didn't think twice about checking the ingredients until I realized that some other brands of clean and vegan sunscreens have horrible ingredients in them. Avobenzone, Octisalate, Octocrylene (the main ingredients) are all on the FDA's list of top most harmful ingredients for sunscreen. I really wanted to love it, but this is incredibly disappointing and I hope they clean it up.
reviews.review_title: Not really clean.. bad chemicals in it

reviews.review_text: I got this last weekend at Sephora and have used it three times. My normally clear skin has multiple pimples this morning. I also got some sun yesterday despite applying twice, being out for about two hours, and wearing a full floppy hat the whole time. I’m actually baffled I guess I should have used more than a dime size with each application. I wish I stuck with cerave.
Best sunscreen Evah!   Not greasy or pore clogging feels sheer going on provides great protection with just a tad used also great primer under makeup.

It is a good serum to put under a good SPF Foundation.  However, unless you wear a good SPF Foundation on top, the serum is not enough to protect you in the Sun.  I have applied this serum with another light SPF 40 Foundation, and it was not enough as I got a sunburn after less than 1 hour in the sun.  So, if you want it to wear just as a serum, it works nicely, but not sure it is good alone as your only SPF protection.  At least, it does not stand the Florida sunshine.
reviews.review_title: Not good as an SPF protection

reviews.review_text: Normal or dry skin maybe work with that. I never recommend for oily to super oily skin. This product to oily for my skin even i was used a little piece.
reviews.review_title: oily to super oily passed that.

reviews.review_text: I am so picky with my sunscreens especially having tan skin and this is by far the best one I have tried under my makeup. It does have a silicone feel and it's completely clear so it won't leave a white cast. I knew I was going to be out in the hot sun and lately I've been a bit oily in my T zone so I tried this under my makeup and will never go back. I wish there was more product for the price but I just feel like it's so worth it. If you're putting it under your eyes make sure to put a hydrating eye cream first because it does make you matte.

I really wish I had bought the travel size of this product instead of the full size because I'm going to begrudgingly finishing this. The texture of this product is very silicone-y, which if you're not applying much, but if you're trying to go with the recommended amount (1tsp), this product feels like it's too much. I feel like I'm rubbing and trying to smush it into my skin and getting no where. Like you're trying to get it to absorb but instead you're just spreading it around your face more. If you try and rub it in too much, I do find it'll have a gritty texture that's unpleasant. The reason I'm giving it two stars and not one is it does dry down into the skin well, which is unexpected given it's texture. I will probably to try use this product by doing two thinner layers.
I love this sunscreen! It's really smooth going on and it works really well.

This is the best sunscreen I have ever purchased. The price is definitely high, but it is SO worth it. I have very fair skin and red/auburn hair, so I burn very easily. Not only does this not have that terrible sunscreen smell, it’s clear on the skin, applies flawlessly, AND it’s not irritating at all to my sensitive facial skin! Highly recommend

I am giving it a one star just because it didn’t break me out and I have acne prone skin but as far as sun protection goes this really didn’t do it for me . I applied and re applied my sunscreen and still got a horrible tan so I’ll stick to my normal sunscreens From now on . Do not recommend

I feel like this sunscreen could work for anyone. It's not greasy yet it's moisturizing. I have mature, dry, sensitive skin and it's perfect. That being said I only use it on pool and beach days because it's water resistant and great for reapplying. I like to use a tinted sunscreen for daily use instead of makeup but when I have used it under makeup, it's been perfect.

I'm 21 and I have olive complexion so regular sunscreens leave a white tint on my face. Tbh this is the BEST sunscreen I've ever used on my face. It felt like it melted onto my skin and it's so light I don't even feel it there. I'm going to use this sunscreen until the day I die bc I'm so impressed with the quality.

It has a great feel and texture and goes on literally invisible under your makeup, so I can see why people like it. However, I am not acne prone at all. I never break out, and I ended up with whiteheads all over my face. Reading other reviews, I am seeing many people with the same issue.

As someone who has sensitive skin and always seems to have white cast or oiliness with sunscreen I haven’t found a good one until one of my friends recommended this one. I fell inlove with it immediately. Will recommend to another friend or person!

Literally holy grail sunscreen! It goes on so smooth and silky kind of like the texture of a pore filling primer without in my opinion clogging your pores. It doesn’t leave a white cast at all and it sets very well under makeup. I can best describe it like a smoothing primer kind of feel and look on the skin. I’ve repurchased this product at least 3 times. I can’t change to anything else!
Zero cast. Great as a primer under makeup. Def has a silicone feel, but that works well for me. Wish I got more for my money.. but oh well.
Weightless & it leaves your skin very smooth & non-greasy! Which is unusual!!

It is clear, so that is a plus if white cast is an issue for you. That being said, I very much did not like the feeling of this sunscreen, it felt greasy and made my skin feel oily. I tried letting it dry and using it under my makeup like I usually do with sunscreen, and my face was noticeably shiny only part way through the day. Not good for my skin type.
reviews.review_title: Not good for certain skin types

reviews.review_text: I do love this product and think it’s amazing and effective, but it is not smell-free. It kind of smells like being at the pool...like a chemical. It’s not strong and it goes away, but I wanted to point out that there is in fact a smell.

I did not like this sunscreen at all. I bought this product because of great reviews. Unfortunately, it’s not for me. It made my skin very dry and patchy with or without makeup. It also made my face oily and it has a very silicony feel to it that I did not like.

I can totally see why this sunscreen is so popular. It feels weightless on the skin, goes on silky smooth thanks to the silicones, and doesn't leave a sticky, white or greasy film on the skin. It isn't moisturizing, but it's not drying either. It's just a pleasant and really smooth sunscreen that feels good on the skin. It doesn't burn my eyes either, even though it's a totally chemical sunscreen. I can see this working really well as a primer underneath makeup because of the silicones, and I don't think it will break me out. I don't feel like it blocks or clogs pores like some other heavy sunscreens. Would definitely repurchase! Unlike any other formula I've tried.
Clear gel and feels like silicone going on. But it was good sunscreen.

Clear gel type. I didn't expect this. I always strive to find a sunscreen not showing white stuff on my face. I saw a lot of good reviews, as soon as the old one(different brane) ran out, I immediately bought this. I am so comfortable to use the sunscreen enough amount to protect my face from sun. This one is forever!

I apply this and I’m still getting sunburnt?? I love the feel of it but it’s not protecting me from the sun rays…. 

I put on a good amount to so I’m not sure what’s going on
Switched to this from Neutrogena and all I got was a sunburn.
LOVE IT! This is my second time purchasing it's not greasy!

I already owned the original and love it. HOWEVER, the mini is not full at all. I used it twice and my sister used it once (just on our faces) and it is noticeably less full. This is basically a glorified sample and I would only buy this if you want to try it a few times before buying the large size. The price per ounce of the small is outrageous.

I was really not a fan of the sunscreen. It felt like I was rubbing a bit of Vaseline onto my face without the oily finish. This was also a very pricey sunscreen and the product was very small. It only lasted me three weeks

I originally was looking just for a sunscreen.  Since using this I have tossed my other sunscreens AND other primers. My makeup stays put all day with this.  It doesn't change the color of my foundation, add excess greasiness to my face, or make me break out. This is a game changer for me. 100% a fan.
Works exactly as promised. Clear, smooth and easy to apply. I will be buying this again for sure. And it’s great that this has a clean rating.

Love this product. This is an SPF that plays nice with makeup, but more than that, it essentially takes the place of both sunscreen and primer. I have oily acne prone skin, so I have to be careful with some sunscreens causing an oil avalanche throughout the day. Not so with this product. I initially received this as a sample years ago and I haven't gone back!
This sunscreen made my forehead break out in little pimples. I only use it on my body now. Disappointing for a $40 sunscreen. I have combination skin but my forehead is not particularly oily.
I didn’t know sunscreen was a must for your skincare routine till this year. This is by far the best facial sunscreen I’ve tried. It’s lightweight and doesn’t leave your feeling greasy
Super light, non greasy, velvety, a little goes a long way.

It feels like I’m putting Vaseline on my face, as other reviewers have said. It doesn’t dry either, it just stays slick all day. Definitely not “lightweight.” I don’t know what other people are talking about when they say it has a velvety soft texture. I returned it.
The absolute best sunscreen ever for the protection, price, and the way it makes my skin feel I would recommend this 100% brown girl skin friendly
BEST SUNSCREEN EVER! I have very sensitive skin, rosacea and acne. You won’t even notice that you are actually using sunscreen.
Love this sunscreen. The satin finish is really nice and doesn’t leave me looking oily after application.
I wish the bottle was bigger for the price, but I like that it’s sheer for my POC skin.

I love this sunscreen!! It doesn’t feel heavy or thick and applies really easily. It isn’t liquidy when you squeeze it out but is soft enough to rub into my skin. This even helped clear my skin up as an extra side affect!!

I really like this sunscreen. It layers well with moisturizers and other skincare products and the finish is great. I have sensitive, acne prone skin and this has not bothered it. I took a star off because I don't like the smell, but it's very subtle and not noticeable after a couple of minutes.

this isn't marketed as a primer but i purchased this to use as one at the recommendation of a sephora employee.  after one day of use, i can say this is the best makeup product i have ever bought.  i applied this as a primer in the morning, and after an 5 hour shift (while wearing a mask) and then a 90 minute workout in the 85 degree summer heat, my makeup is still almost completely intact.  the added bonus is that this is actually a sunscreen so i don't have to worry about applying one separately.  if you are questioning this at all, i would HIGHLY recommend trying out the sample size, you won't regret it!
Love this sunscreen use it every day. Nice and light. I also apply it on my part and it doesn’t make my hair greasy.
Holy grail of sunscreens ! No gloopy feeling .. extremely silky and easy to apply. Leaves no white cast at all and doesn’t make me an oil pan!
My skin is very oily but I finally have a sunscreen that works for me! I have been trying several different brands of sunscreens, and I NEVER find one like this!
This is the first (and only) sunscreen that I enjoy wearing.
most sunscreens that are marketed as invisible are COMPLETEEE bs and are lying. but this... is literally INVISIBLE. i’m absolutely in love.
Amazing sunscreen. It acts like a primer. I love how velvety this feels on my face. It’s my favorite ever.
Love this face sunscreen. Does not clog pores. Goes on smooth.

I don't understand how an oil free product can leave my face feeling so slimy.  All day long it feels like this sunscreen is just sliding off of my face.  My glasses slide off, everything.  The only thing that has changed in my routine is the addition of this sunscreen.  I do love the finish, and that it has no cast, but I won't be buying it again.  Who wants to feel like they landed face down on a pizza all day?
reviews.review_title: Oil free but my face feels SO greasy

reviews.review_text: I have fair-light skin and a family history of skin cancer, so SPF is a must for me. I was always hesitant of wearing sunscreen on my face because of the white cast, weird smell, and problem layering makeup on top. This solves all of these issues, and now I wear sunscreen every day. It goes on clear and matte, and your skin even feels soft after application. I swear it makes my skin just look better.  EVERYONE should be using this!
reviews.review_title: This should be on your face already

reviews.review_text: Fantastic! The only sunscreen I’ve tried that doesn’t break me out. It works great on my oily-combo skin and the velvety finish almost doubles as a primer. Great under makeup or by itself. I have no need to continue trying sunscreens. This is a staple for me!
My new DAILY sunscreen. Fell in love with the way it is absolutely invisible and the texture is not sticky, it disappears. Amazing. Love it!!!!!
reviews.review_title: So light. Blends in and disappears into your skin!

reviews.review_text: I wasn’t sure if I would like this product. When I first got it, it did feel a little greasy and I have oily skin so I was concerned. When I first tried it I wasn’t a big fan but then eventually I got it into my skin routine. I ended up liking it a lot then I did from the start. I am now going on my second purchase!

This is my first sunscreen investment and let me tell you—this thing is worth it! A little goes a long way so this will last you a while. I have combination skin that falls on the more oily side and this does not make my skin any more oily. My makeup sits perfectly right on top with no problems. You will no regret purchasing this product. You get what you pay for.
reviews.review_title: If you’re on the fence, get it!

reviews.review_text: A total game changer! This has completely helped clear up my skin. I feel like other SPFs would clog my pores and has a cast. This product is amazing! It has reduced my clogged pores,applies well with make up and leaves my glowy.

I always used to break out when I use sunscreen on my face so I went on a mission to find something better. This stuff is amazing, it is so soft and my skin stays clear. It works under makeup or on its own at the beach. 100% worth the investment.

i have oily skin and i use the mineral matte screen and this one is also a very good sunscreen! goes on extremely smooth and feels very good on my skin. kind of matte which i like , my skin can get a little bit oily throughout the day, but i didn’t expect it to be considering it never said it was “matte”.

personally i thought this sunscreen was ok.  there's no white cast which is great and it's easy to blend in but i ended up looking like a disco ball.  great if you don't look oily afterwards and if you're willing to pay $36 for a small bottle.

The product claims to have SPF protection however after fully covering my face and being outside for about an hour on a sunny day my face was totally burnt. Totally recommend actually wearing sunscreen as this has no coverage.

Does pill if you aren’t careful with your products. Has a nice velvety texture you don’t get on any other sunscreen on the makeout howverr the high amount of silicones didn’t make my skin look nice and started to make it dull and etc. No white cast so good for dark skin.
Don’t like the feel texture of it. It feels like smash box primer the silicone feeling, will clog the pores. Is not moisturizing at all in case you are looking for that.
Awesome stuff. Goes on like velvet and stays matte. I love it I’ll always repurchase this as I’ve been looking for a non greasy sunscreen forever

The biggest thing going for this sunscreen is the absolutely zero white cast it offers. And for that, it gets three stars. But I really found the texture to be sorta silicony and tacky, which was the last thing I wanted to put on my face, frankly. I was really looking forward to loving this product, but I think it's really a matter of taste -- if you're fine with that texture, then you'll like this.
Exceptional sunscreen! This is the FIRST sunscreen or product with sunblock that doesn't break me  out.   10/10! Holy grail product!

no white cast ✅
sinks in fast✅
non greasy✅
easy to blend✅
non sticky✅
unscented✅
affordable❌
if this was $34 for 3oz or 5oz It would be so worth it but for 1.7oz the bottle is so tiny and it's not even completely full so I don't thinks I'll buy it as often as I'd like for such a small amount of product but if it comes in a bigger size for the same price I'd buy it forever.
reviews.review_title: Checks all the boxes except price.

reviews.review_text: Yes yes and yes!!! I love the fact that it’s clear and still feels hydrating and moisturizing. Definitely going to keep using for a long time
This product works well but I am not a fan of the silicone feel on my skin. I much prefer the glow screen to the unseen sunscreen.

I love love love this sunscreen. Feels great on my face an most importantly is actually clear and “unseen”. I have darker skin so traditional sunscreen is very visible. Unscreened clean is truly clear.
DONT purchase this sunscreen. JUST DONT! Used for only two days and Made me breakout with little white bumps on my chin and cheeks. Not for sensitive skin.  I wish I could give zero star.

After being a waterfront lifeguard for the better part of a decade I am obsessed with sunscreen and wear it every day rain or shine, summer or winter. Although I struggled to find a sunscreen that didn't give me blackheads and that would also protect me from blue light. When I received this as a free sample this product was a dream come true, and I just had to buy the full size. It protects me from the sun and screen light and not one blackhead. I feel beautiful with my glass skin and protected from the sun as well as the aging and skin cancer it can bring with it. I'm not sure how many tubes I've gone through over the years, but I do know I'll be buying it again and again for a long time.
Love this sunscreen! No white cast and feels soft on the skin.

I was pleasantly surprised that after trying the sample size of this finish I ended up really liking it. I was always hesitant to try it because the description of it feeling silicone-like made me believe that it probably wasn't going to pair nicely with makeup and my oily skin. I found that applying this evenly was a breeze and it spread easily, it is definitely undetectable and blurring and ends up setting. I have to try it under makeup as I'm trying this out after a chemical peel and can't wear any. I like that there's only one ingredient in here that has the potential to be pore clogging but that's dependent on how much of  that ingredient is used in the product itself and the users skin so this isn't even a major concern - that's definitely way less than competing spfs. I will continue to use this product.

I like the texture and the way it dried. But it doesn't keep you very protected from the sun. Was outside for about an hour and my face got so burnt. I even applied a bit extra knowing I was going to be outside for a bit. Not worth Not worth hype.
My absolute go-to! Thick but goes on so smooth and acts as a great primer
Feels amazing on. Light weight, so perfect. I won’t ever go back to traditional sunscreen.
reviews.review_title: Feels so light! Love this stuff!!!

reviews.review_text: I don’t think I will use another sunscreen again. A little goes a long way. I now want to try the matter formula.
One of the best sunscreen I’ve used. It’s not greasy at all and it works great on dark skin. I would love for it to be available in a bigger size.
amazing sunscreen! so lightweight and not oily at all!
Not a fan, broke me out and pilled. Wouldn’t recommend
Love it. Goes on really smooth. I put it on after my skin care routine and before my makeup.
I love this. As soon as I put it on I stop feeling it. Lightweight and no white cast which I love.

I really wanted to love this. but if you use enough of it to make it an effective sunscreen, your makeup will never stick to your face. I can only use it in no makeup days, even though it is a primer.
This was definitely different from every other sunscreen I've used but I like it. The texture took some getting used to but it works well underneath makeup and protects my skin.

I absolutely love this sunscreen. 

I have had it for a few weeks now and this is now my second favorite sunscreen behind the Supergoop! Glow Stick because I personally prefer a dewier finish and I have dry skin.

This sunscreen easily melts into the skin and does not leave a very shiny or matte finish, it looks more natural in my opinion. It doesn't feel like there is a layer of product, it almost feels like nothing is there. 

My favorite use case for this sunscreen is when I'm working in my home office which has quite a few windows.

Sometimes I'll use serums in the morning, and this sunscreen doesn't pill up or get gummy when applied on top of another product.

I have been loving this product. It has the weirdest, coolest texture and I really enjoy the fact that it’s not sticky and oily. I’m fair skinned and know the risks of skin cancer and want to avoid that at all costs! Wear your sunscreen people! Just wish it was more affordable, but honestly I use the smallest bit every day that I think it will last me a while. The texture of this makes it spread a lot so you don’t waste.

Best sunscreen. Hands down. Period. No arguing. 

Not only is this invisible and able to be used by ALL skin tones (stop white-casting!! create diverse products!!) it’s safe for the environment and sensitive skin. I mean come on......there’s no reason not to buy this.

It doesn’t burn under eyes, it doesn’t dry you out or make you greasy. It’s the perfect matte smoothing product to go on bare skin or under makeup. 

Tips: LET IT DRY DOWN GIRL!! Stop applying sunscreen then smashing on product. It won’t work. You have to let it sit and absorb before you start beating your face to Jesus.

If you want a moisturizing sunscreen, Supergoop has different options. Always layer on a hydrating serum or moisturizer before this and you’ll be fine! Pat into skin! Load up! Apply to neck and ears! 

It’s worth it.
Goes on smooth like a priner and never feels oily. It works well under my makeup.
Obsessed with this. It feels so soft and works great as a primer.

This is decent product, it’s just not something I prefer. It has a very silicone feeling when applied (I hate this feeling) but it does set nicely. I typically buy the glow screen so this product simply didn’t give me what I was looking for but I’d say it’s a decent sunscreen.

I love this product! It's greasy when you first apply it, but sets beautifully and makes your skin feel like velvet. There is no white cast at all. I'm giving it 4 stars for the following: 1) my eyes are super sensitive to something in the sunscreen and I tear up without fail when I use it, and 2) it has the SLIGHTEST smell of gasoline. The best way to describe the scent is like when you've closed your car door at a gas station but can still smell gasoline. That's what this product smells like to me. The scent is super faint, doesn't linger, and nearly undetectable once you work it in. Other than those two things, I would highly recommend it!
I love it . It’s sooo good under makeup ! Not too heavy !

I love the texture and the way it feels when I put it on my skin. It also gives you a really pretty dewy-but-matte glow. Unfortunately, it makes me break out, specifically on and around my nose. :( I’m not THE most breakout prone person, but I do have sensitive skin. So so so sad this doesn’t work for me.
When I rub this on my face it feels like i’m rubbing bacon fat or lard on my face. I can’t get over that feeling. But other than that it works good! It works well with makeup
Love this sunscreen, love the brand and creator as well. There’s nothing like this sunscreen, the texture just glides on your skin. Super clean ingredients also. 100% recommend.

The best daily facial sunscreen! I wanted to start wearing sunscreen more consistently and have been testing sunscreens for the last year. Unseen sunscreen is hands down my FAVORITE. I have sensitive, acne prone skin and it did not cause redness or make me break out. I love its smooth gel texture and the way it primes my skin for makeup. When I don't wear makeup I'll just keep layering it on and it doesn't feel heavy. Love love love this sunscreen!

This is great if you want a sunscreen without a white cast, and if you want a matte look. My goal is to make my skin look brighter, so I bought the glow screen and it’s much better. The texture didn’t bother me, like others have mentioned.
I love this sunscreen! It works well and feels nice on my skin. No breakouts either

When I first bought this, it was perfection when I applied it my skin. However, as time went on I noticed that whenever I used this sunscreen after certain skin care products, it would ball up and peel off my face. "Maybe I put the sunscreen on before my skin care could dry down?" So I waited until it dried down, that didn't work! It would still ball up and peel off my face like soft silicone. I am very picky when it comes to sunscreens because my standard is Clarins, which I've been using for 5 years now. They haven't re-launched their sunscreen due to Covid. Some may not like Clarins, but it works for me. But to get to the point my standard is Clarins, I need my sunscreen to work with whatever skin care products I choose to use. I really liked this sunscreen at first: it did not break me out, I did not irritate my sensitive, dry skin. I would still recommend it, just watch out for what products you use, it may not mesh well with them.

Definitely a great option for avoiding issues of whitecast! The very silicone heavy texture was easy to spread but I also it found it a bit uncomfortable to be applying the full amount needed to use this as a sun screen. It left my skin feeling a bit warm after application, but not sure if that’s the ingredient or my having rubbed it around.

(Purchased this as part of the 2021 Sephora sun kit.)

This is my all-time favorite sunscreen. It has a completely natural finish. It is not shiny at all. It has no smell. It has a lovely silicone, primer-like texture that fills in my pores. I will never buy another sunscreen again. I just wish it came in a bigger bottle!
This sunscreen offers great protection with no white cast.

Love this! I’ve been testing out sunscreens and haven’t found something I could safely put around my eyes (eyelids, undereye). Either it takes too long to settle and stings my eyes (biossance) or leaves a white cast (la roche posey ) around my eyes. This doesn’t do either so love  to finally have something I could put on my whole face! It does leave a glowy look which I like but probably wouldn’t recommend to someone who leans on the oily side.

There are of course cheaper primers that can do the job but the benefits, hydration but not clogging attributes to the SUPERGOOP! line are unmatched to me.

It feels like a lite but quality hydration but if you have dry skin or are in need of a bit more moisture i’d recommend the Supergoop Mosturizer (it has a light consistency but thicker feeling on the skin that is hydrating) or the Glow oil or Glow stick that is a “protective” moisturizing sheild layer that is a higher concentration of hydration.
it does not feel like sunscreen at all since it is a clear gel. it feels greasy for a while after applying.

This sunscreen is a true joy to use. I’m not a huge fan of the daily lotions and potions routine, but I actually look forward to putting this on. It feels like velvet. I took off one star because I feel like I still need to wear a hat (I have melasma) since it’s only spf40 and I know it would be impossible to achieve this texture with mineral sunscreen, but I really wish there were some way to make a mineral sunscreen that felt like this. Overall though it is an amazing product. You will not be disappointed. I will buy it again.

Buy it, buy it, buy it!!! So I been using the La-Roche Posay sunscreen and moisturizer but I felt like my skin got used to the formula some how and my skin would peel after 2hrs so I decided to switch it up!! And omg let me tell you I’ve had my eye on the product for while and I’m so glad I did! It so easy to apply it feel light weight and non greasy!! It blends in beautifully with my skin and no peeling!!!

I’m hooked. NO WHITE CAST! clear prouduct, leaves no residue and has no odor! feels like a primer i’m able to wear it alone and under my makeup. it doesn’t dry out my skin and doesn’t leave it oily either.
reviews.review_title: YOUR SIMPLE GET TO THE POINT REVIEW

reviews.review_text: Is it pricey? Yep. But is it worth it? Absolutely. This formula is extremely unique, with a lightweight, gel-like texture that blends into your skin without any tint or white cast, and leaves no oily residue. I used to skip sunscreen because I hated every product I tried, but this one has me excited to wear it everyday. There is no scent or smell. Works great on its own or under makeup (doesn't slip and slide around).

it feel gross when applying. it feel like i’m rubbing vaseline all over my face and i find that it does make my makeup slide around :/ it looks nice after first applying but find that layer it looks greasy and doesn’t help when wearing makeup overtop
reviews.review_title: i dont like the texture or feel of it

reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this so bad but couldn’t get past the texture. It felt very thick, similar to the velvety soft matte feeling of the Smashbox primer. I suppose if you’re planning on wearing a full face of makeup, it would be a good choice, but for someone who doesn’t wear makeup on the daily and wants a thin application of sunscreen, this isn’t for me. I’ll be going back to my EltaMD sunscreen. I will say, supergoop’s formula is very clear and “unseen” so it’s true to its name. Just not for me.

I wanted to love this because I’d heard some good things but I immediately hated the way it felt on my skin. It was like putting on a greasy, silicone primer that sat super heavy on my skin and didn’t dry down. Despite not loving the texture I tried to persevere but then realized that I was breaking out horribly with large, kind of painful zits— something I haven’t experienced in years. The last straw was today when I ate outside for ~an hour and I ended up with a (mild) sunburn. I’m super careful about applying and replying sunscreen bc of my family’s history w/ skin cancer and I still got a sunburn which is unacceptable. Throwing this away and never buying it again.
Definitely clear, works well but literally smells like chlorine somehow. I like it but not enough to repurchase from the smell.

Wow. I wanted to start adding spf to my skincare now that I’m inching to my 30s. This has a very light scent and goes on so velvety smooth like a primer. Didn’t make my face greasy and then added foundation on top and looked very well together. I already love this so much!

I’ve been using this every day for two weeks and I’m not sure it’s going to work well as an every day sunscreen for me. My skin is sensitive to most sunscreens so I bought the mini to test before committing to the larger size. My skin does tingle when it’s applied but so far it hasn’t felt like burning. I have had a lot of mini breakouts on my cheeks since I started using this. My skin also feels oily and slimy, especially when I wear makeup like powder blush (I don’t wear foundation, concealer or highlighter). Most days I can’t wait to wash my face to remove it.

This is my experience. If you have sensitive skin, maybe but the mini to test it first. There are so many great reviews, which is why I tried it.

I am pale AF and sunscreen is basically my religion. This is the best! "Unseen" is no joke - it goes on clear and stays clear. It keeps burns and freckles at bay, and has never broken me out. I'm on my third bottle and have no plans to switch any time soon.
Amazing sunscreen that absorbs quickly and is completely invisible. The texture is great - like a really good primer. No breakouts. Holy grail product!
Love the feel of this sunscreen. Very smooth and non-greasy. This is my 2nd bottle and I still love ittt.

Got this in the Sephora Favorites kit and and I love it. I like the Lancôme sunscreen better for wearing under makeup. This has a silicone feel and I my foundation transfers more with this underneath. However this is my go to bare face sunscreen.
I love this sunscreen. It doesn’t clog pores and is sweat proof too so no more stinging eyes! It has a really nice velvety feel to it and works great under make up as well
Love her. Wear her daily for ultimate protection! I find  unseen sunscreen is the perfect makeup primer too. What’s not to love?

OH MY GOD YES. This sunscreen is incredible. It’s completely clear. It has a velvety pillow texture. It rubs in completely naturally, meaning if you put on a glowy skincare product before it, your skin will be glowy. If you used a matte product before, your skin will look matte. If you didn’t do either, your skin will look normal. As for protection: it works. I didn’t get sunburned. It’s so nice! I love it. I have dry and sensitive skin, with mild to severe rosacea:D

I’m trying not to be too judgmental because i have only actually used one other sunscreen consistently many years ago that I also did not like. Im trying to be better about sunscreen bc I do know how very important it is, so I will finish this product. I just found it to feel very much like silicone, and I don’t like that feeling on my face...especially when I’m not wearing makeup. It makes my face not feel clean and like it’s not able to breath which is annoying. If I’m wearing makeup it’s not as bad.
