I did have high hopes for this and unfortunately it did not meet my expectations. I am curious about the new Sunday Riley’s sunscreen that is a hybrid of both chemical and mineral. I believe there are better options out there that do not have a silicone feel to them that would work better for non makeup days...which for me are most days now.

I love this sunscreen. I'm a medium light skin person, so sometimes sunscreens can leave a white cast on me. This product is so great and goes on so smooth. I think depending on the products of you routine, there could be pilling. I experienced pilling when my skin was peeling, so it's not a moisturising sort of sunscreen. But otherwise, it goes on real smooth, unscented [or very neutral, I should say], and I do not dread putting it on. [Let's be real - sometimes sunscreen is a chore!] 
Unless you're using a powder foundation, I wouldn't use this as a primer - it's quite slick after you apply it. Would recommend for all the medium tones and darker! :)
My favorite sunscreen. Doesn’t cause my skin to breakout, provides great protection from the sun with a nice matte finish.
Ditched Glossier's Invisible Shield for this and have never looked back. It doesn't make my face oily and my makeup glides on easily. Love love love!

love it!!! I had been looking for a sunscreen for my face that did not feel oily or looked white on my face like usual sun screens this one is light weight does not feel oily and it's clear I wish they had a body sunscreen like this because its perfect.

Flawless. The most perfect sunscreen ever. Give it 5 minutes to absorb into your skin. It will feel like it's just sitting there with a silky film. Just wait 5 minutes, then put on makeup or whatever. I hate the feeling of anything on my skin but 5 minutes is worth the wait for this sunscreen. It does sink in and leaves no white cast (I'm brown) and doesn't interfere with makeup. A vitamin C serum first makes a big difference underneath it--that seems to help it sink in a little faster.
I am so pleased with this sunscreen! It is not greasy or oily at all - it completely melts into your skin with minimal scent. Definitely recommend!

I only use mineral sunscreens so when is as this one I had to get it. The smell isn’t too great, honestly I hate it. The whole unseen wasn’t relatable. I had a slight purplish hue from The white cast, but it did fade away as the day went on. I wouldn’t repurchase this as I have tried others that work better but this isn’t a bad place to start.
The best sunscreen for under makeup!! I can’t think of a better product for using under makeup.

This is my favorite face sunscreen and I use it all the time. I apply it almost every day and it never leaves white spots. It’s also very light so I love that it doesn’t feel heavy on my face. Great daily sunscreen

Like a fool I just confidently bought the largest size of this because I had seen so many people like it and my beloved Krave beet shield turned out to be a lie so I had to find a sunscreen fast. I’m not one for returns so I will finish this bottle but I won’t be purchasing again. 
I like my sunscreen to feel weightless and sink into my skin, this one has a strange silicone texture that sits on my face for a long time before any of it sinks in. That is not all of it sinks in anyways. It rubs off easily no matter what I do, and it’s not an invisible feeling at all. 
I gave it two stars because it is completely “unseen” since it comes out and goes on clear so if you don’t mind a silicone texture and it never sinking in then you’ll probably like this product.
reviews.review_title: would not recommend for krave lovers!!!

reviews.review_text: My mom and I absolutely love this sunblock! It applies so smooth, glides right over the skin. It does not leave a cast after, nor is it oily or makes your skin feel powdery dry like some sunscreen. It gives a moisturising feeling as well! I would give it more stars if possible!!! Love it!!
Love that my glow was still able to shine through since it seemed to have a slight matte finish

After seeing countless Tik toks on how great this sunscreen was, I figured it was worth a try. Sadly, I don't get the hype at all. I do have to say it stands by its name for being “unseen” and is a great option if you have issues with sunscreens leaving white cast or not being opaque enough. However, that’s about where my “ooh ahh” factor ends with this product. It does have a very soft feel for texture, but feels very silicone heavy once on my face. Literally reminds me of SmashBox Photo Finish Primer, but with SPF. I never break out from products, this one made me break out like a 13 year old. First product that has done that to me in years. For $30, this is meh in a bottle for me.  I’ll pass on the pimple party and stick with my Paula’s a choice Youth Extender.

I wanted to replace my face sunscreen for something that didnt cause breakouts, and this is it ladies and gents. I even use this gentle formula (THAT IS REEF-SAFE btw!) on my hands, neck, chest face, etc! Its so silky and absorbs into skin without feeling greasy oily or anything! It truly blew my mind at how it met those claims. I’ve tried many (La Roshe, Glossier, Neutrogena, REN) and none come close to this good Supergoop Unseen Sunscreen. Highly recommend. I have oily skin and I love this stuff, it does not make me oilier.
reviews.review_title: best sunscreen for all skin types

reviews.review_text: Upon first application, this feels like a mild primer (the kind that's meant to hide pores, like the Benefit Porefessional perhaps), although it doesn't really hide pores too much. It definitely does not leave any white cast (but i am a pretty pale lady to begin with). Can't say that the sunscreen is better than some of my LaRoche Posay SPF lotions, but the texture of Unseen Sunscreen is so comforting when I apply it that I decided to get the biggest bottle.

I have dry/acne prone skin and I've been looking for another sunscreen after the Krave Beauty Sunscreen was discontinued. This product pills very easily if any other products are on underneath. It has a velvety texture but to me it just felt like it was mixing with my other products instead of layering. Not my favorite sunscreen.

This mattifies my skin and doesn't make it greasy. Also, I'm not allergic to it. I know that the coral reefs are important but this is such a great spf for me. It doesn't leave a cast or oil residue and the scent is not an obnoxious sunscreen scent.

I was on the search for a sunscreen for so long! I barely started getting into skin care and realized how important it is to have sunscreen in your daily routine. They’re are two things I LOVE about this product.

1. It lasts a LONG time
-You only need ONE dime size application for a decent amount of exposure to the sun. If you are constantly in the sun you may need two applications one in the morning and another for midday to maximize results 

2. Once you apply it to your skin it disappears. I’m so glad I don’t have to worry about a white shade on my face when I apply this product

All in all, this product is so good for those with Normal to dry skin. It provides moisturizing and protection to your face. SO in love!

I have oily/combo skin and I have always hated wearing sunscreen because I hated how heavy it felt on my skin. I’ve been looking for a lighter sunscreen for a while now and this is perfect! It’s light, absorbs well into the skin, and is perfect under makeup. The one thing I would say is that if you’re going for a natural glow-y look, this is on the matte side. I know this brand also has a formula that is better for that type of look, but I haven’t tried it.

I love that this is "invisible" and perfect for under makeup but it does have a silicone-like feeling. It has a slight scent that doesn't bother me but I do notice that it leaves me a little oily throughout the day.

Made my eyes burn and red after a few hours of using, the redness lasted through the next day. I did like the finish on the rest of my face, it kept my oily skin pretty matte. Would not be good to apply around your eyes if you have sensitive eyes like me, otherwise would recommend.
It’s a good sunscreen, don’t get me wrong but it is DEFINITELY scented. I have to wait a little while before I put my mask on our I feel like the scent is going to suffocate me

I've struggled with finding a face spf that doesn't break me out, make me oily, or have a white cast, but I think I have found it! This applies like a primer and there is no oily shine, if anything it makes my face more matte! Doesn't feel heavy or anything. Definitely recommend!

this is absolutely amazing! I LOVE the consistency! I hate most sunscreens cause they're runny and they sting my eyes but this one is great. It has a consistency similar to primer and it goes on so well. I actually enjoy wearing sunscreen with this one.

This is hands down the best sunscreen, both for effectiveness (fading dark spots) and looks (I no longer have a white cast). With my brown skin, I've tried a million different sunscreens (Neutrogena, EltaMD) to see what worked for me, and I've found that this is the only sunscreen that I can put two fingers worth of (which is how much you should be putting) and not have a white cast. My issue with other non-white cast sunscreens is that they have a fragrance which my skin is averse to. I do agree that it is pricey, but I'm excited to follow a fellow reviewers' advice and cut the case open when I think it is finished. I have to say that first timers but think that putting this on feels greasy and weird, but it dries down great. Putting makeup on top isn't a hassle either.
reviews.review_title: Best sunscreen I've used (and I've tried a lot)

reviews.review_text: Made my skin break out in tiny bumps all over, NOT for sensitive skin that is prone to acne. It’s too harsh for sensitive skin

Overall I think this is an excellent sunscreen and would be amazing option for those with darker skin tones. It also looks quite natural (ie less greasy) than most chemical sunscreens I have used and the sunscreen smell is not too apparent. It dries down quickly to a natural finish, so would likely be a good option for most skin types. My biggest gripe with it is that the texture is extremely silicone-y. It almost feels like a pore filling primer if that makes any sense. I prefer sunscreens that feel more like lotions, but that’s a personal preference. For those who like that kind of effect, this may be the perfect sunscreen for you. For me, I will not be purchasing the full size once I use up the mini one that I have from the Sephora sunscreens kit.
reviews.review_title: colorless, but too silicone-y for my taste

reviews.review_text: Best sunscreen ever! I like how it blur the wrinkles and it’s colorless. Already bought 3 times.

I would put this in the middle at 3.5 stars for me. While I like that it’s literally transparent and doesn’t show in the skin, I find that the texture is a bit too silicone-y for my taste. I use about a teaspoon’s worth, which is what is recommended by the dermatologists I follow, and then I feel like after applying all that that it’s prone to pilling. Sooo while this isn’t terrible and I will still use it up, I prefer to wear it on my no-makeup days or as a back-up when I’m out of my cheap Japanese sunscreen.
LOVE this sunscreen. Looks great under foundation and doesn’t break up throughout the day. Doesn’t have a strong sunscreen smell which makes it easy to wear everyday. Not sticky at all.

I actually really liked this product. It has kind of the texture and look of vaseline, but when you put it on your skin it does not feel greasy. My only complaint is that, in my opinion, there should be more product or a bigger bottle. Especially for the price. But I have acne-prone and sensitive skin and it made me happy that my skin did not react negatively with this product.

As a darker-skinned lad - I'm Indian (South Asian) - it's not always easy finding a sunscreen that won't leave a white/grey/blue cast on your face and make you look like an extra in a Bollywood adaptation of The Walking Dead. THANKFULLY, this product does exactly what it says - it goes on completely invisibly! It feels great on my skin - light and easy to apply. It does give your skin a very matte/natural look, so if you prefer a more dewy/glowy finish, I'd suggest the Glowscreen, but honestly, this is like a holy grail sunscreen product.

I like that there’s no white cast and can be doubled as a makeup primer. In terms of its priming abilities it’s not the best I’ve ever used (I’ve used the hourglass veil mineral primer for years) but my makeup didn’t slide off of my face by the end of the day. I have super oily skin and the 1/2 teaspoon of this just didn’t absorb into my skin even though I blended it for quite some time and waited about 10 minutes before applying makeup. I’m sure it works for other people but just wasn’t for me!
reviews.review_title: Does what it claims to do

reviews.review_text: this stuff is amazing! it’s so soft and glides on. it feels like nothing on my skin with almost no smell. which is saying a lot for a product with spf. will but bigger bottle next time.
I really enjoy how easy it is to apply, no need to work in. It is silicone type, on days where I am oily I avoid it.

Wow, everything I have been searching for in a sunscreen for my face. Love how this product is clean and lightweight. Goes on and within minutes blends into my skin so nicely. Feels so smooth and doesn’t leave any of that white residue. This is amazing! Was so happy to get this sample. I had to purchase the supersized bottle. Definitely something I want to keep in my routine and use everyday to protect my skin from the sun.
reviews.review_title: I love this! thank you! finally a great sunscreen.

reviews.review_text: Oh I'm sad. This just did not work for me, as much as I hoped it would. My face does not like silicone primers, and unfortunately, this was no exception. I did enjoy it before my face started breaking out. It worked well with my vitamin C and moisturizer, and did not pill. I recommend buying a small sample to test it out if you are unsure whether or not this will work for you.
reviews.review_title: I Wanted to Love it But...

reviews.review_text: I love this product so much! I had a sample and HAD to buy the full size! It really does not feel like sub screen at all! It feels great on the skin and it gives me a matte/ natural look that sets a good base for my skin
WOW! I WILL BUY NOTHING ELSE. PERFECT ON BLACK SKIN! NO CAST NO GREASE NO RESIDUE!
reviews.review_title: AMAZING FOR BLACK PEOPLE OR OTHER DEEP TONES

reviews.review_text:
Pros: I actually like the feel of this on my skin, and I didn’t have any major breakouts from it. 

One major con: Unfortunately, it did not actually protect my skin. I’ve used plenty of tinted moisturizers with a lower SPF and had no issues. I was outside with this on my face walking my dog from 4:45-5:30 PM and my entire nose burned. I can’t even remember the last time I had a sunburn on my face... sadly this will be a return for me.

Of course, I had to check out this product after viewing it on Tik Tok. I like applying this at the end of my skincare routine & it really does go on "unseen!" It also acts as a primer for my makeup & I feel as though it is a two-in-one product in that regard! Slight sunscreen smell but nothing overpowering. Only downside is the price for the amount that you get :( will be interested to see how long this lasts...especially since dermatologists say sunscreen needs to be re-applied throughout the day.

I have sensitive skin and this broke me out! I noticed my skin would get itchy and a bit irritated when wearing this. Its a bummer because I liked that there was no white cast and it was a good primer for my makeup!
reviews.review_title: Didnt work for my sensitive skin

reviews.review_text: I got a sample packet of this to try and I am impressed. There is no oiliness by mid day and it sinks in so well. I am also a fan of their matte screen. I would definitely purchase this when the rest of my sunscreens are used up.

I love this sunscreen. I have super sensitive skin and also rosacea so finding a sunscreen that works for me can be a challenge. A lot of sunscreens contain ingredients that can aggravate rosacea, but I’ve not had any issues or reactions to this product. I love that it’s fragrance free since my skin can also react to some ingredients that are used to add fragrances.  This goes on nicely and leaves my skin feeling soft.  Since it’s clear I don’t see any type of discoloration that can come happen with other sunscreens. I took one star away simply because I don’t feel that this works as a primer like the packaging claims. I definitely notice a difference when I use a primer on top of this than when I apply my foundation directly over this product.
This is the only sunscreen I've ever looked forward to putting on my face. The velvety soft feel of it is wonderful.
The BEST sunscreen. Perfect for underneath makeup or on its own because there is no white cast or greasy look.

My husband has had multiple run in's with skin cancer and Mohs surgery that has him now a sunscreen fanatic. We have tried lots, but he hates the greasey feeling and white cast that it usually leaves. HOLY HANNAH! We have a winner y'all. Never have I EVER had my husband TELL me to go to Sephora and BUY SOMETHING. Well, he did with this. Glides on, no smell, no cast, no grease. Worth. Every. Penny.

I contemplated Supergoop! for a while now but was perfectly content with my sunscreen and decided not to experiment. However, recently my favorite sunscreen was discontinued and as I was contemplating what my next move was I decided to finally try the Unseen Sunscreen. I decided to go all in and get the limited edition 2.5 oz and I love it! It is to be noted that I have brown skin and despise a white caste but this is clear as it comes out the bottle and even clearer on my skin. My skin is also oily but this doesn’t seem to intensify that like some sunscreens do. I don’t know if it has much of a smell but that’s a good thing, it doesn’t have that off putting sunscreen smell. My eyes are rather sensitive to certain sunscreens but this one does not irritate them. Additionally, I observed the zinc sulfate in there...in the time of covid and mask induced acne I was happy to see an ingredient with potential anti-bacterial properties in my last step skincare item...and my oily skin approves. Then there is how it works with my other skincare products, my moisturizer leaves my skin with a smooth dewy finish that I love. I was afraid this may change the results in texture and glow that I achieve with my morning moisturizer like some sunscreens are prone to doing but it doesn’t. It actually compliments it well. Lastly, I hope they keep this size around. For all the sizes they offer and quality Supergoop! is quite affordable for a non drugstore sunscreen but I get lazy and would like as much time between ordering items or running to the store as possible so I don’t mind paying the larger price tag for a larger bottle. I would love to forever be able to purchase the 2.5oz as this is now my go to sunscreen.

The best facial sunscreen on the market in my option. Clean ingredients and safe for sensitive & acne prone skin. Goes on like velvet and doesn’t cause acne or rashes on my skin type unlike the majority of other facial SPFs I’ve tried over the years. Been a loyal Supergooper for two years now. PLEASE KEEP THE BONUS SIZE IN STOCK <3.

Literally by far my favorite sunscreen. It doesn’t break me out and I can wear it all day long without it pilling or getting caked up. It’s basically the same color and texture (a little thinner) as smashbox photo primer. I’ve tried others and ended up swapping from the Coola vegan SPF drops (pink bottle) because this one was just that good. Highly recommend! Got the value size before it sold out which is totally worth it.

i Looove this! i have combo skin and this works great, it doesnt leave my skin tacky or oily, great for acne prone skin, it’s kinda clear so it doesnt leave a white cast at all, super soft and light weight!! it has no weird smell too which i love worth all your money
I love this sunscreen! It doesn't breakout my skin and gives skin a velvety finish. Obsessed!
Been using this product since Sept 2020 and so far loving it. It goes on smooth and not sticky, so I don't mind applying it everyday. I like how it doesn't have fragrance either.

I’ve used a few other sunscreens since I’ve tried this one and I’ve yet to find one that fits my routine as well. It’s wonderful under makeup (has the same texture as the Smashbox Photo finish Primer) or by itself. As long as I give it a few minutes to absorb I don’t have issues with pilling when I put something on top of it. As a redhead with fair skin, I’ve tried SO many sunscreens in my life and this one is absolutely the stand out when it comes to facial sunscreen.

I really love this product! I also love that it doesn’t smell like sunscreen/SPF. The texture reminds me of a makeup primer. I’m super sensitive and this product has been great on my skin! Definitely a must in your everyday skin routine!
reviews.review_title: A Staple In My Skin Care Routine

reviews.review_text: I really wanted to love this. The texture was gel like, almost like a primer, and it went on really smooth. The reason why I am giving 3 stars is just because it didn't react well to my skin. I've tried this at different times thinking it was just my hormonal acne, but I've now realized that this is the culprit for why my skin breaks out. It might work for non-sensitive skin, but it just didn't work for me who has acne prone, oily skin.
reviews.review_title: loved the texture, but my skin didn't love it back

reviews.review_text: in terms of texture and look, this sunscreen is so good at making you look glossy but not oily, and you don’t feel oily either. it dries on your face pretty quickly. it’s not white either, so there’s no issue with white streaks on your face. the only reason i would refrain from giving the full 5 stars is that i learned the hard way (burning) that i had to put a lot of it on my face in order to be protected while suntanning, so keep that in mind. once i figured that out, it worked perfectly for me.

I wanted to like this product but it is so oily on my combination skin.  I rarely break out but this product caused irritation with  my skin.  The price tag is a bit high and my face was so oily later in the day.
Love this sunscreen! It’s a clear gel so it goes on really smoothly and feels light. It doesn’t make my skin shiny like other gel sunscreens and doesn’t make me break out.

I would definitely recommend this! I have combo skin, and I was using the tinted sunscreen from this brand but it was really annoying and the tint would go on my mask. After I finished that I purchased this and it's sooooo much better: the texture is more smooth because it doesn't have that makeup feel (both are creamy though) to it, it also is clear and silky, almost like an oil without looking shiny (kind of like primer). I also am someone who cares about clean beauty so this is great. This has not given me any breakouts.
I haven't written a review on sephora in a long time but I really wanted people to look into this, buy this over the tinted version for sure. I haven't used the matte version so I can't attest to that.
I really like this sunscreen. It works as a primer under makeup and I can also put it on before a run and it is one of the few sunscreens that does not run and get in my eyes during a tough workout.

This sunscreen is probably the best I've ever tried, it's a clear gel so it goes on with zero white cast. It has a velvety finish, not too dewy and definitely not matte. It does have a kind of weird smell at first, but fades quickly. I love this sunscreen because you don't feel that greasy layer of "Oh yeah I'm wearing sunscreen" that you do with most others. Only real con is that it's pricey.

I've been using this for over a year now and I still love it. I love the matte, non greasy finish. Overpriced, but I don't know of anything else like it.

Note though, when you think you've finished it, cut it open. There will likely be two to three weeks more of product. It sticks to the sides and won't come down. I almost threw it out but I found it hard to believe it was finished already for how long I'd been using it. I couldn't get a drop more out of the tube pictured but look what I found! Once I cut it open, I keep it in a zip lock bag and scoop it out with a spatula. Don't waste a drop of this pricey sunscreen!
reviews.review_title: When you think it's empty, cut it open!

reviews.review_text: One of the better sunscreens I’ve purchased. Like that there is no white residue. Would purchase again.
Love this! It goes on so smooth - not oily at all!

This is my all time favorite facial sunscreen. It is like a clear gel. It goes on so smoothly and feels like a primer. It works so well under makeup or looks great on it's own. It's the only sunscreen I use now, it's seriously the best. Highly recommend
Really loving this as a makeup primer. It’s lightweight and I don’t get oily when I use it.
Love it. I have combination skin, this is not oily at all.

This stuff is amazing and truly unique, as far as sunscreens go. It’s more like a mattifying primer than a traditional sunscreen, so if you’re like me and you hate the greasy, white cast most sunscreens leave you with, this product is what you have been waiting for. Leaves your skin with a smooth, velvet finish and works great paired with SuperGoop’s SPF mineral powder.
LOVE this product. Such a great weightless consistency, while providing protection from the sun. My new staple!

Contemplated this purchase due to only the large size being available. I am so glad I did! I have sensitive skin and love this product! Very lightweight! I wear everyday and even forget that I am wearing. Reminds me of the ysl primer! Read that this could be used as a primer. Awesome, awesome product!

Yooooooo, as a person of colour, this TRULY is clear. NO gray cast, no purple cast, no ashy-ness and I don’t look casket ready! Upon first application, it has that typical sunscreen scent but it goes away quickly. It has a natural finish, not oily, and doesn’t feel heavy.

This is going to sound awful but I hated wearing sunscreen everyday because it always made me look ashy AF, a lot of sunscreens are oily and break me out so I would only wear it when I would outdoors for an extended period of time. 

Now I’m literally gonna be good and wear sunscreen everyday.
reviews.review_title: Where have you been all my life?

reviews.review_text:
Sunscreen specifically for your face is a relatively new concept. Growing up I used to put body sunblock on my face and hope for the best (no breakouts, no irritation). In walks 2018 and the game changed for our faces. I've tried a lot of "face" sunblock - this is the best. I haven't tried the other Supergoop! blocks but if you're looking for a lightweight, streak-free, high SPF block, look no further. Worth every penny and lasts a relatively long time. 

The initial feel of this is a little oily, but it doesn't last that way on my skin and it rubs in nicely and feels fine under makeup and over other cremes.
Amazing spf. This mini version is over priced but it’s the perfect size to fit in my bag as a back up in case I forgot to put on spf before leaving the house or to reapply!

After seeing countless reviews and promo for this, I felt compelled to try it. Honestly, I don't get the hype at all. I have oily skin normally but this made me look like I was in some oil face product commercial. Returned, not worth the oiliness.

This sunscreen is more like a gel primer. Its really easy to use the recommended amount. Its clear so no white cast. I havent found a foundation that doesnt agree with it. Its absolutely not oily at all. It almost dries down into a powdery like feel. I also feel like it keeps my oils at minimum. I cant compare it to the matte sunscreen since i always purchase this one but i understand why so many people love it.

I was excited for this but it seems like it would be better used as a primer rather than a skincare product. I have sensitive, acne-prone skin and it broke me out after 2 days of use (pictures in natural & indoor lighting below) It also pills over my skincare and feels grainy. I just wanted a sunscreen I could wear on its own without white-cast :(
Love this product! Great packaging, and melts immediately into my skin and disappears. I use it every single day and it also works great as a makeup primer!

I love this sunscreen!!! Best sunscreen I’ve ever used!!! I’m sad they say it’s limited edition, I hope Sephora keeps it around. 

I have normal to combination skin. And I have struggled to find a good skin that doesn’t peel, or leave a white cast. And this is the one. It’s so luxurious feeling when I rub it into my skin it is well worth the price.
Works amazing with makeup! Feels like a light weight primer that isn’t greasy feeling. Would recommend it!
I love this Sunblock! Goes on super smooth and no white cast or shininess. It is what I always wanted from face sunblock.
reviews.review_title: Live in the Caribbean and Love this sunblock

reviews.review_text: Really great matte sunscreen. Has the potential to pill and not perfect under makeup, but better than most for wearing without makeup!
I have oily skin and this leaves the best texture for a Sunscreen. I love it.

I actually really liked the way this made my skin look smooth and of course the sun protection from the spf. Unfortunately it made me break out really bad so I had to stop using it. I would recommend this to those that don’t have acne prone skin but if you do I would stay away from this.

This is a sunscreen that you ‘want’ to use. Typically I dread applying sunscreen because of all the effort it takes to blend into my skin. This one is effortless, lightweight and the best part is NO WHITE CAST. Highly recommend giving this a try!
reviews.review_title: an easy to use sunscreen with no white cast

reviews.review_text: This is the absolute best sunscreen I’ve tried, and I’ve tried a lot. The texture is velvety, it leaves a matte finish which is great for oily/shiny/combination skin. I have extremely sensitive skin and this has not caused any breakouts. I will always repurchase. Great for laying out and also great to layer over moisturizer and under makeup!

I’ve been wearing this for a couple of weeks and so far it’s been great, just what I was looking for. No white cast and did not change my foundation color.   I have extremely dry skin and this has helped my skin and helped my foundation concealer apply evenly and did not highlight the dry patches. For someone who breaks out easily this did not break me out or clog my pores/make them bigger as others noted. It also has a very very light sunscreen smell that I personally like. Overall I would definitely recommend this product, will be purchasing again!

This is such a great sunscreen. It protects my fair skin from the sun and I love that it’s transparent so I don’t have to worry about white cast. It doesn’t seem to clog my pores and serves as a great primer on the days I wear makeup. It’s pricey but definitely worth it and more reasonable than the Murad Invisiblur. I can’t recommend this highly enough and hope Supergoop never discontinues it!

So amazing! I live in a really sunny state so I need SPF every single day. I apply this and it’s almost like a primer. I don’t apply concealer over it normally but when I do it applies perfectly over this. Also, haven’t broken out once and my skin is super sensitive. 10/10
reviews.review_title: The best in the game baby

reviews.review_text: This is my third purchase of this and I love this. I use it on my kids since they hate the white cast that some other spf products do esp on the face. I used it when we went to LV in the summer and I didn’t get sunburnt at all. Highly recommend!

I bought this after hearing the hype for months and let me tell you it did not disappoint! It has a very thin, silicone like texture that just glides some effortlessly over skin. I use two full fingers worth of almost product daily (I have a tinted mineral sunscreen I sometimes use instead) and this 2.5 oz bottle has lasted me almost 6 months already! I’m probably close to empty by now but this is definitely a great buy if you’re into chemical sunscreen! I’m planning on sticking with physical sunscreen for awhile but may come back to this in the future!
Nice definitely for darker skin tones but a little smaller then expected

I’ve honestly never liked or been a fan of sunscreen but I know it’s a necessity. I’m in my early 20’s and I’ve decided I want to start taking care of my skin in terms of sun damage and to prevent any further aging signs so I tried out this product. Let me just say, it really is unseen and unscented. It applies sort of matte and has no smell at all. It gives you virtually no shine or white cast and it’s literally invisible. It’s very lightweight and you can barely feel it. I really, really love this product. I didn’t wear any makeup over it, but it didn’t pill throughout the day either, so I’m assuming it wont under makeup. Never thought that I would feel this comfortable applying sunscreen. Will definitely repurchase when I’m done with this one!

I love Supergoop and this product is no exception! I have always had issues with sunscreen eventually making its way into my eyes but haven't experienced this at all with this product. There is zero white tint and makes a nice primer. I do break out a tiny bit if I use this every day but that might just be me. This is absolutely worth the money and you need it!
This is my and my boyfriend's favorite sunscreen. I made sure to purchase a couple of the value sizes for the summer. Although it's pricey, it's effective and it goes on clear.
Glides on beautifully and is super lightweight. My dry skin doesn’t feel tight or congested after applying.
This product is so light and does not cause my skin to breakout
I enjoy using this sunscreen because it mattifies the skin, it is very light and goes well under makeup!

Great sunscreen! It does have that sunscreen smell, but in my opinion it does not linger. The sunscreen is clear, so no white cast but I also have white skin so you may not need my opinion in that area. It feels almost primer like and works great with makeup on top. I have had bad breakouts with chemical sunscreens in the past, but I haven't had any issues with this one. I am loving it!

I like this for under makeup but honestly it’s way too expensive for what you get. Nearly $40 for 1.7 oz? You can get medical grade sunscreens with the same chemical, invisible formula for the same price and get 3 oz. won’t repurchase.

I really love that this sunscreen is clear so it is very BIPOC friendly!! However, like other reviews have said, it does feel a bit slippy and greasy like a pore-filling primer, and for me I had experienced pilling when I layered it on top of my skincare. 

I recommend mixing the sunscreen in with your moisturizer when applying, which got rid of the pilling problem for me! Also minimizes time too! I don’t recommend this sunscreen for those with very oily skin however, since it may feel too heavy. Overall, it still is a good sunscreen!!

I received a free sample of this and I have always been wanting to try it. I applied my normal moisturizer and then this. I noticed right away that it did not sink in - it stayed on top of my skin like vaseline. I waited and waited to apply my makeup. I thought if I waited long enough this would absorb. I was wrong. I started applying my foundation with a sponge and by the time I was finished, this sunscreen was all over my shirt and all over the floor - in tiny little pills. This made me realize that I could never stray from my favorite SPF Shiseido Ultimate Protection Lotion SPF 50. Yes it’s more money but man, it is so worth it.
reviews.review_title: probably the worst I’ve ever tried

reviews.review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! As a woman with very pale and sensitive skin, THANK YOU! I love that this is SPF and doubles as a primer. I will continue to purchase this stuff as long as they make it. My makeup goes on flawlessly and the added SPF protection is just icing on the cake. Thank you supergoop!
Great sunscreen. Works great as a primer. Does not pill and does not irritate the skin like many other sunscreens I have tried do. Also does not have a strong smell
Best sunscreen hands down!! Goes on so smooth and makes my skin look amazing!

Feels exactly like the smash box photo finish primer so if you don’t like the feel of those kinds of primers, I wouldn’t suggest this one. Made my skin oily and I just didn’t like the feel of the product on my face overall. Felt oily and nasty all day.
Got a sample of this with my last order and I’m sold. Love it and I’m definitely going to buy it as soon as I’m out of my current sunscreen!
The scent lingers on the face after several hours. It also clogged every pore I worked hard to minimize. I will not purchase this again.
Feels weightless on the skin, works well with makeup over it too
I received this as a trial product with an order and ended up purchasing it immediately. It beats creamier sunscreens that muck up your skincare and clog pores. This is super light and feels great.

I know I’m supposed to wear sunscreen everyday, I know it’s an important part of skincare, but I HATE it. I’ve always struggled with the smell, the weight of it, and the white cast. This is basically a miracle. It’s somehow Smashbox Photo Finish primer with SPF. It blurs my pores and it absorbs immediately. I’m actually more than happy to wear SPF daily now. If your skin doesn’t like silicone based primers this probably won’t work for you, but if you are good with them then you should buy this immediately. They have a travel size so you don’t have to go all in to try it out, but I only had it for one day before I ordered a full size bottle.

It is clear like described, however I really hate the texture of it. I know the name is even super goop but every time I put it on it just feels like Vaseline or something that feels pore clogging. I have super dry sensitive skin and I felt like an oil slick wearing it. So pros it is exactly as it describes the product to be, cons it just wasn’t for me. I switched to paulas choice one and love it more.
reviews.review_title: not for everybody but maybe for you

reviews.review_text: NOT FOR OILY SKIN!!! I really wanted to like this but it feels like you’re spreading grease all over.... your face will be extremely oily 2 seconds after applying.. idk what the hype is about

I have a hard time believing this stuff is actually sunscreen. It’s so silky when you put it on your face, it melts so nicely. It does have a hint of sunscreen smell but I mean it’s not overpowering and...it is sunscreen sooo

Absolutely my new favorite clean product! Leaves the face silky after just a small application, and is a perfect primer before make-up. Also, my skin is usually sensitive to sunscreen products, but it doesn’t break out with this one. Last but not the least, I love that you don’t get that strong sunscreen scent you get with other products. This is definitely a must-have in my daily skincare arsenal.
reviews.review_title: You need this facial sunscreen in your life!

reviews.review_text: There’s a reason Supergoop has the cult following that it does. As a first time buyer I can say that no other spf or product with spf in it is as great as this one. It wears well under makeup or on its own. And it is truly “unseen,” there is no color or shine and it does not really have a smell. I recommend!
The best sunscreen for under makeup. Perfect for those who hate the texture or the white cast of regular sunscreen. It feels like a matte primer.

Best sunscreen i’ve used in a long time! The texture is like a primer and sinks in to the skin so nicely. It’s not a lotion if that’s what you’re looking for but it works great over my moisturizer and i’ll definitely be using it for a long time!

This is the BEST sunscreen for everyday use. It is clear so you don’t have to worry about a white cast, it isn’t greasy at all so it lays on the skin naturally, and there is absolutely no scent. It has a unique texture because it doesn’t lather you up with grease the way other sunscreens do. I
 tried another sunscreen and quickly realized I needed to switch back to the supergoop one. If you want to incorporate sunscreen into your routine, please do yourself a favor and buy this one!

Great sunscreen! At first I found the texture to be a bit strange, but I love that it is not scented, applies easily, no greasy residue, and leaves my skin feeling great. As someone who didn't previously regularly apply sunscreen because I disliked the textures of other products I tried, this product easily incorporated into my morning routine.
In love with the velvety texture. It’s spf and primer! Works great under my powder foundation. A little goes a long way.  I also love that the size is perfect for travel.
This feels so amazing on my skin! Love how lightweight it is, how well it works as a makeup primer, and knowing that I’m being protected from harmful UV rays.

I was so hesitant to buy this product with the price, but I’m really glad that I did. as everyone says, the texture is very strange, and the second you put it on your face you can feel it mattify. I wouldn’t go for this if you have dry skin, but for my extremely oily skin, it works great. makeup can be easily applied on top which is awesome. this is the only sunscreen that works for my acne prone skin!! despite the price, I will absolutely repurchase when my current tube runs out.

it comes out almost oily/gel-like but absolutely dissipates and isn’t noticeable or doesn’t affect any other skincare/makeup. i don’t love the texture but it works so i guess that’s good enough for me

This sunscreen is amazing. This is the first high end sunscreen I’ve used in my life and I’m not disappointed. My extremely fair skin is protected at all times. When I first started using this sunscreen it wasn’t pairing well with the moisturizer I was using and it had the most odd texture. They worked fine alone, but when applied on top of each other it was a disaster. However, I recently switched moisturizers (this one is oil free) and they pair perfectly together.

It’s starting to warm up outside so this Supergoop Glowscreen Body SPF 40 is perfect to give my skin a boost of glowing beauty and at the same time protect it from the damaging UV rays of the sun! I love the summertime smell of this and it’s not sticky and doesn’t feel greasy like other sunscreens.
Love this sunscreen. Keeps my face protected. It’s a little too thick to reapply over makeup.
Really weird texture. Good if you want a matte finish but dries my face out

I am not 100% sure which ingredient did it, but something in this made me break out in hives on my neck, ears, and around the outside of my face. I wouldn’t recommend if you have sensitive skin. Also made make up look cakey, I felt like it increased the definition on what lines I do have.

this was a bit of a splurge for me since i usually only use cera ve sunscreens but it was well worth it. in the morning i like to use a lotion but in the afternoon I never want to reapply since I have combo skin. this is perfect for a mid day reapplication without wrecking your make up or making your skin greasy

Woow. It’s unlike any other sunscreen I’ve used before. My big thing was trying to wash SPF off my hands after. This took onee wash! And it wasn’t greasy at all. Very smooth. Melted in. And I look matte still! No smell. Ah! This makes me happy to wear SPF daily!!! Excellent product.

This sunscreen is disgusting and I gave it to two other people to try so I know it’s not just me. It left all of us super greasy. I don’t hate silicones in general, but something about the formulation of this makes it sit on the skin like you’re wearing a layer of oil. It also caused my pores to clog up after a couple of days of use and resulted in a bad breakout which is unusual for me (and I’m not sensitive to silicones so it’s something about the formulation in general). It is clear but that’s literally the only positive aspect. So confused why this is so highly rated.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this sunscreen. This is my go to from now on. It’s light weight and smells amazing.

I am so picky with sunscreens, they either smell to strong, leave a white cast, never sink, and pilling etc. This is amazing, its gel like and INSTANTLY soaks in. It feels satiny. I highly recommend. I also have sensitive skin and this is great!!!
reviews.review_title: NO WHITE CAST, NO SMELL, SINKS IN FAST

reviews.review_text: Honestly the best sunscreen I have ever used!!! Recommended.

i love that this is clear because i have medium to medium tan sensitive skin. the only sunscreens that used to work on me were super white and super thick sunscreens, until i found this one. no white cast whatsoever. it feels a little greasy when you first put it on, but it quickly absorbs. love it!
This is my favorite sunscreen ever! I've been using this one exclusively for over a year now.  I love that it doubles as a pore-blurring primer.

I wanted to like this so much, but it irritates my skin. It oxidizes my foundation too, so I always look redder than I am - and if I use a generous portion of product, then I turn extremely red. It also just doesn’t work that well. I have super oily skin and I read this works well. But I accidentally went a day without primer and realized my make up stayed better without it.  And it pills pretty badly. Overall, disappointing.
looks and feels like rubbing aquaphor/vaseline all over your face. a very weird feeling, will not be buying more.

Disappears right into my skin and doesn’t mess up my makeup. Also, doesn’t irritate my skin! 
Love it.

Favorite sunscreen to wear under makeup. It acts as a primer so I am getting sun protection and an awesome primer in one! If you like a silicone feeling primer, you will LOVE the unseen sunscreen. Best part....no white cast! Also doesn’t leave your skin feeling oily like some sunscreens do.
This thing break me up so bad! I must say that my skin isn’t sensitive and there’s not much products which can break me up but this sunscreen does it after single use. I guess it’s just not for me

If you have dry/really dry skin you probably won’t like this. I have combination skin, oily t-zone and I’m kinda dry around my mouth and chin area. I always use a moisturizer before, and put this on top. I love the slight glow it gives but still leaves my oils in check. It’s literally undetectable under makeup which is why it’s my favorite. The silicone feeling kinda disappears after a while once you start producing your own oils. If you have combo/oily skin you’ll prob love! It’s also pretty unscented but I get what people mean about the slight chemical smell. I don’t mind it and it doesn’t break me out
Love this sunscreen! Not greasy and wears well under makeup!
No white cast. Goes on even and smooth. Just got this and I'm already ordering a backup!

I was excited for this sunscreen, especially for the unscented aspect of it. I understand "unscented" to mean the product will have no smell, but this sunscreen smells CRAZY strong like chemicals. I know it does not contain harmful chemicals and the ingredient list is clean, but if you are sensitive to smells, beware. They obviously did not add natural or synthetic fragrances to the product but I would not call this "unscented"  or safe for folks with chemical sensitivities by any means.
reviews.review_title: Whoa CRAZY smell! Scent sensitive people beware!

reviews.review_text: While there is definitely no white cast, the texture of this sunscreen is awful. It’s like a slippery, silicone-y, greasy feeling texture similar to the smashbox photo finish primer (but without the priming properties). Luckily it doesn’t leave a greasy feeling on my face but it definitely messed up the look of my glowy skincare routine and made my makeup look super dry. I’ll stick to my k-beauty lotion sunscreens thank you very much

Wasn’t bad but wasn’t great. I had previously been using the Purito Sunscreen (RIP) and I loved the way it made my skin look. Unfortunately, this one is really greasy & it’s a little too thin for my liking. However, it’s also not horrible & it does not leave a white cast! Might re-buy during the spring sale event.
love this so much, it just melts into my skin and doesn’t leave anything. i like the smell of it too because it reminds me of summer.  :)

This is by far the best sunscreen for your face that there is.  It's a clear-ish gel that is silky, fast absorbing, and scentless.  It feels great going on, and does not pill with your actual skincare.  There is no white cast, nothing to rub in until the color wears off.  I also put this on my neck and hands.  What a genius product!  I'm so glad I decided to try it.

This is more of a first impression because I’ve only used this twice but HOLY COW it was an instant favorite. It is UNSEEN under your makeup. I hate the way sunscreen feels on my face and it always looks so greasy especially under makeup but you cannot even feel this one. It makes my makeup application so smooth too. It definitely reminds me of the smash box photo finish primer. It has the same texture, color, and smoothing properties. I can never use regular sunscreen again. I also like that it barely has a scent.
Love love love. This sunscreen actually looks and feels like I have nothing on it’s amazing. It’s the only sunscreen I’ve found that doesn’t leave an oily finish.

Best sunscreen I've ever used! Goes on thin without leaving the dreaded white cast. The only knock against it is that the logo on the tube rubs off and is glittery so it gets everywhere but totally worth the annoyance.

I’m really liking this so far! I’ve been using it for about a week now, and have been able to use it by itself, as well as under makeup. I use a toner, moisturizer, and under eye cream in the mornings, and this tops it off nicely. I do use a primer before makeup, but even without, this works nicely as a primer. It feels velvety and smooth when applying, and a little goes a decent way. So you’ll get a lot of use out of the bottle. I do notice some minimal shine later on in the day. And when I say little, I mean no more than the “end of the day shines” I normally get from running around all day anyways. It’s very lightly scented-nothing crazy or overpowering. For it being an extra layer of protection, I would recommend this! Especially for the upcoming summer months. It’s very lightweight! This will definitely be a repurchase!

This sunscreen has no white or purple cast at all! It mixes well with other skincare products and works well under makeup! It gives me a good glow and it doesn’t irritate my skin! i love this and i’ve repurchased it 3 times.
it’s so nice on the skin, no white cast and leaves skin so smooth and has a beautiful satin finish on the skin. Best sunscreen I’ve ever tried.
Perfect, weightless sunscreen. Feels like makeup primer, and serves well as one too!

I am so disappointed in this product. I was looking for a light sunscreen for my combination skin. This sunscreen made my skin a grease pit. I didn’t expect this to leave me excessively oily like it did! I tried to use as little product as possible, but that did not help either.
reviews.review_title: This made my skin so oily.

reviews.review_text:
Skin type: normal 

This is my second purchase. I wanted to try a different brand but nope. I returned that spf the next day. 

This spf has a matte finish and even perfect for a primer for your makeup! I apply 2 finger lengths and it covers my entire face/ears/neck. I apply this product after my moisturizer has been set on my face for 10 minutes. I love that it doesn’t leave me with a white cast. It takes 15-20 minutes to absorb into the skin.

I love it; it's lightweight, not greasy or goopy at all, moisturizing and it works. I'm a runner in New Mexico, so I'm outside a lot, and the sun is intense and I need something that can take the heat and the sweat. I use it every day, mostly by itself. I love that it's a "clean" product - I don't wear hardly any makeup, so it feels clean on my face, which I like.

i bought this to try a new sunscreen and it was just okay. for myself, i have a pretty extensive skincare routine and the way this product combined with my skincare at the end of my morning routine left little pieces of product around my face and as it “dried” it just looked like i had insanely dry and peeling skin. the texture is very silicone-like, similar texture to the pore perfect or benefit primer. i think it does it’s job alright, but really just didn’t combine well with my products (i use a lot of the ordinary in my routine). 

if you have a simple routine it may go alright with your products and i think it definitely has worked well as a primer, but as someone who doesn’t wear as much makeup, i think there are better sunscreen options out there!! really depends on what you’re looking for.

3/5 because the product itself is pretty good, good primer and doesn’t leave a white cast, but thick silicone texture and didn’t sit well on my skin.

I have the second size. And it’s a very good sunscreen however, it does have a slight greasy feel but there is no white Cast whatsoever! It’s amazing. It doesn’t really have that strong smell, but you can still smell it. Overall I do recommend this product. But if you find a cheaper dupe go with the dupe.

I have brown skin and this sunscreen leaves absolutely no white cast which is amazing. It also feels very nice and velvety when you put it on and I didn’t have any bad reactions. However I work really hard to give my skin a Dewey glowing finish and found this kind of drying and mattifying. If you are oily and you want that this is absolutely the sunscreen for you. It’s just not my preference.

This is the best sunscreen on the damn planet! It makes my skin SOOOO smooth. It makes my makeup/other skincare look and feel AMAZING. I’m never going to stop buying this. It’s worth the hype and worth your $$$. There is not white cast AT ALL and ends in such a velvety finish. It’s truly amazing, if you’ve been thinking about it, JUST DO IT!!!!
reviews.review_title: STOP DEBATING, JUST GET IT JUST GET IT!!!

reviews.review_text: Got this as a sample and then purchased the full size. Bought this since I live somewhere sunny and I'm awful at wearing sunscreen. I have an oily T zone and I'm super dry around my mouth and chin. This goes on smoothly since it's silicone based and doesn't pill at all. I haven't burned either, and I love that this can be used as a primer under makeup. Taking off one star since it's a tad drying and I've noticed a few more pimples around my chin-- although that could be from my mask too.

Overall: This sunscreen is great I love it compared to the million other sunscreens I’ve tried at the drug store. It’s not oily and sits so nicely under my makeup. My dry skin is nicely protected by this and doesn’t exacerbate my eczema like mineral sunscreens or overly oily sunscreens do. 

Pilling: Please for the love of god I had to make this review to put my two cents in, THIS SUNSCREEN ONLY PILLS WHEN YOUR MOISTURIZER ISNT ABSORBED INTO YOUR SKIN!!!! It happened to me TWICE and I searched it up to as why and it really was the moisturizer I was using was too thick and just sat on my skin. Please give your moisturizer some time to set then slather on the sunscreen. That’s all.

I finally tried this after hearing so many good things but I was quickly disappointed. I blame myself for buying without reading the ingredients first (something I never do but it was an impulse buy). I’m not a fun of products with silicone or silica and the second I rubbed it onto my face the first time I immediately knew there was silica and it wasn’t going to go well. If you have dry skin this is not for you. The silica will dry your face out from the moment you put it on. Also this is a chemical sunscreen that uses avobenzone as one of its active ingredients. Avobenzone is shown to break down in the sun within 30-60mins of the exposure. This does not mean it’s completely ineffective because there are other chemical sunscreen ingredients included but dermatologists and doctors recommend you either wear a physical sunscreen or use a combination if you truly want to protect your skin and this is only a chemical sunscreen. It may not seem important those of us in our teens, 20s and 30s but I know I want to protect my skin for the future. Anyway, this isn’t the one for me but I do believe SuperGoop has other good protective sunscreens!

I decided to purchase this based on all the good reviews. I had to return it. First off it didn’t matter how much I would put on, it would always clump up in little balls on my face. It felt like it would just sit on top of my face and not get absorbed. It does have some blurring effect on your face. It just didn’t work for me.

I was really looking forward to this product as so many people have raved about it and this brand. Unfortunately it did not work for me at all. As another reviewer mentioned, it pilled across my forehead almost immediately. I thought maybe my face was just dry or I needed to pat it in more but nope. It pilled right off every time. I also notice my face burns when I wear this in the sun. I’ve never had trouble with my skin in this way and this is the only new product I’ve added. So disappointed!

I was a little bit hesitant when buying this product because of the price but let me tell you IT IS WORTH EVRY SINGEL PENNY!! I love how lightweight it is and it feels amazing on the skin. Its so great, no fragrance, no white cast, doesn’t peel. I was a little bit scared because I always get allergic reactions from sunscreens but I didn’t get one from this one and Im so happy. Will defined buy again and again
reviews.review_title: LOVE IT AND ITS POC FRIENDLY!! x

reviews.review_text: I have dry skin and this does not make my skin worse, it does not leave any residue, on the contrary It leaves my skin silky, I just love it, I was wondering if I should buy it but I was not wrong and I would definitely buy it again.
reviews.review_title: perfect for me and my dry skin!!

reviews.review_text: I am a light olive complexion in the winter and combination, acne-prone skin. This does not pill on the skin even after my extensive skincare regimen. It doesn't leave a white cast and it does not leave the skin oily or sticky. It doesn't irritate the skin unless it gets in your eyes. It works great for the winter and I'm excited to see how it works in the summer.
reviews.review_title: Truly unseen! Super velvety and smooth!

reviews.review_text: I love this sunscreen.  It is weightless and not greasy at all.  Most other sunscreens break out my skin, but this one is awesome.

It goes on clear and has a matte effect, very similar effect to Benefits pore. The only dislike is that it does not go well with foundation, but if I’m going face naked for the day then it is absolutely great! This will be my savior for summer beach days.
reviews.review_title: Yes if you are not wearing makeup with it

reviews.review_text: If you’re contemplating whether you should spend the money and buy this or look for a cheaper alternative, just buy this. It really is clear and a little goes a long way. Your 34 or however much it is dollars won’t be wasted with a month’s worth of product. I’d say this could last at least  2  1/2. There is no smell and once you put it on, it feels like there is nothing there.
I was so shocked about the quality of this sunscreen. It’s sheer and goes on like velvet. Almost feels like a primer. Does not leave your face greasy at all. It makes wearing sunscreen daily easy.

If you like that sort slippery silicone feeling, this is a great sunscreen, but it's just not for me. It goes on clear with a slight chemical smell and doesn't break me out, which is great, but I will continue on my search for the right sunscreen for me.

I am surprised I actually enjoyed this sunscreen and will likely be repurchasing this as my daily sunscreen. As opposed to other lotiony face sunscreens, this one feels like a silicone makeup primer. I think because of this, it does not leave the white cast that most sunscreens do as it is more clear and gel-like than white and liquidy. Makeup also applies easily on top (probably because of the primer-like consistency). Smell is not very strong but definitely smells like sunscreen.

Wish it wasn’t so expensive because now I’m hooked and will keep paying for it lol great under makeup, doesn’t look greasy at all, feels nice/absorbs well. Have only been using for a few days but hasn’t caused any breakouts

I liked that this product didn’t leave a white cast and applied nicely to the skin. I just strongly dislike the way it feels texture wise, it feels almost oily and kinda greasy. I really did not like the texture I prefer a sunscreen that feels more creamy.
reviews.review_title: Nice sunscreen but not the texture

reviews.review_text: This sunscreen applies well, and leaves my skin looking lively and smooth. No stinging eyes, no obnoxious smell, no white cast.

I was scared to use sunscreen on my face because I have such sensitive skin... but this is amazing. I notice a change and even if I don’t wear makeup this makes me feel pretty and glossy. Recommend 100%

Sunscreen went on nicely but not sure how this is clean as it's full of chemicals. It did have an invisible finish. Just depends on if you are looking for a physical sunblock vs a chemical one. If you want something slightly cleaner but not zinc, this would be a good option.
reviews.review_title: Not bad for a cleaner chemical sunblock

reviews.review_text: The sunscreen goes on so smooth. And it doesn’t flash back in pictures. It has no smell so it feels good so use a product with light to no smell. I use NARS and it goes on smooth and it doesn’t get oily either. I have used it with MAC foundation and I have seen oily spots but only in high oily area like nose, forehead, and chin.

Undetectable! It feels a bit oily but not as much compared to other face sunscreens I've tried. I was worried about my makeup (with setting spray) melting off after a while but there wasn't any noticeable changes. Before covid and during the summer, I would wear the milk primer because of it's great grip so I really don't mind how this feels, since it feels a lot lighter. I'm glad it doesn't have a strong scent, no white cast and protects against the sun (to a certain extent). I'm repurchasing after giving the first one away.

This sunscreen is life I tell you life. It’s so lightweight and smooth. It doesn’t feel greasy or oily even when I’m layering other products before and after, and this was a big concern for me since I have oily skin. Oh a little goes a long way!

The texture of this sunscreen feels really nice, but I noticed it tended to sting a bit in more sensitive spots on my face like the corners of my eyes. I'll finish it, but I probably won't repurchase.

I have dry dehydrated skin (even in the summer) so a ‘hydrating’ sunscreen would be nice but overall I’m looking for something light and soaks in. This sunscreen feels exactly like a thicker Smashbox Original Photo Finish Primer, heavy and like an uncomfortable layer of silicone. This did not set and made my face feel gross all day. Not that I necessarily wanted it to set (and clog my pores) but it would rub and transfer when the slightest touch of anything touched my face. I guess it worked as sun protection but I just cannot get over the feeling. If you are OK with the texture, I guess I would recommend this.
Love the texture! Not greasy, blends in smoothly, perfect primer before applying makeup.
The most lightweight sunblock that goes on without any residue and gentle on skin.  It definitely lives up to its name, unseen.
Absolutely love this product , goes onto smooth, scent is very very faint, no grey cast. Perfect for all seasons!

I bought this in December and have been using it since. It’s clear, so amazing for brown skin girls like myself. I hate the chemical smell it has. It has a nice velvety finish once it’s applied, but it feels like a super thick layer on my face which I don’t like. I have oily, acne prone skin, so I’m very picky with spf and just any skincare in general. This made me greasy within an hour of applying, which I don’t get when I use other spf. I also don’t wear makeup everyday so I can’t attest to how it wears with makeup. I’ll finish my bottle and I won’t be repurchasing it. I enjoy the new black girl sunscreen with a matte finish way better than this. It’s clear like unseen but doesn’t feel heavy on the skin at all. Sadly this didn’t work for me.
reviews.review_title: Did not work for me sadly

reviews.review_text: Great product! I have combo skin and works so well with my skin and makeup.

Completely invisible on my skin and melts in like a moisturizer. I have sensitive skin and if it doesn’t like something I will experience irritation, inflammation, a dry spot, or something that ruins my clear face. My only qualm is that it’s so thin that I can’t tell if I should apply more or not lol. I’ve used Fenty beauty’s sunscreen and though I love RiRi, it just be the dye or something that my skin doesn’t like but it causes dry patches on my skin. I’ve also used sun bum’s face stick  since it’s super moisturizing and for someone with eczema (though mild) it was even to greasy/thick for me. Super Goop is literally the best I’ve tried - weightless, invisible, goes on well over my thick moisturizer, and doesn’t add unnecessary shine or sheen.
I enjoy this sunscreen, it's very easy to put on because it's clear, however, it has a very silicone-y, makeup-y feel to it, and I found that it feels kind of icky to reapply.
Love! Love! Love! It doesn’t make my face greasy and it evens out my skin tone. Just a great product.

I really wanted to love this sunscreen. So many people rave about it, plus it’s clear! Unfortunately this caused my skin to become very reactive and congested. I’m getting lots of little bumps and blackheads from it. I also had a hard time getting used to the feeling of the sunscreen. It’s so slippery and slimy feeling to me. I will say that I am very picky about different sensory experiences. This product just didn’t work for me unfortunately

Love love love this sunscreen. The feel and application is the best i've ever felt from a sunscreen - it goes on so smooth and works well with any makeup. It protects my skin no matter what the activity, from skiing to running. This has become a very easy part to incorporate into my routine.

Perfection... I was on the hunt for an SPF for daily use. I was using a moisturizer plus SPF but I felt like it ran into my eyes by the end of the day... not this one! It's light and doesn't feel like your typical sunscreen. Goes on incredible smooth.

this is an amazing sunblock to use before make up it has a blurring affect pore filling it doesnt feel greasy at all and no white cast its really great and i love how its spf 40i know im getting the right amount of spf!!

I was SO excited for this product cause of all the reviews and thought maybe I’ll give it a chance. Nothing against the brand, I do believe in their products but my skin is oily acne prone and I don’t think my skin was loving this sunblock :(. I got so many breakouts after a month of using this sunblock and I’m thinking the product just wasn’t sitting well on my face and was clogging my skin cause as soon as I stopped using the product my skin cleared up again. I would avoid this product if you’re prone to breakouts like I am and have sensitive skin.

I love this sunscreen. I am very fair skinned and need sunscreen every day no matter what. I glides on smoothly and stays in place. I prefer a chemical sunscreen over mineral because I have oily skin so it doesn’t slide off. MOST importantly it does not sting my eyes! Have tried countless others and always come back to this one.
reviews.review_title: Great for fair oily skin and sensitive eyes

reviews.review_text: Perfect 2 in 1 product to reduce steps in your routine. It gives you the  UV protection needed and primes for makeup. It comes out clear so it’s perfect for all skin tones and doesn’t leave a white residue behind.

My favorite sunscreen, I keep an extra tube in my purse incase I forget to apply before heading out the house.

PROS: not greasy , goes on clear 
CONS: not any!
Amazing sunscreen! It does not make your face white or greasy. It blends in so smoothly and easily, it’s almost like not wearing anything at all!

I love this product, but felt really mislead by the advertising. This is not natural or clean, rather, it contains harmful chemicals. Physical sunscreens are healthiest for skin, rather than these chemical sunscreens.
reviews.review_title: Know your ingredients, the marketing is misleading

reviews.review_text: Love this! This is the first sunscreen I’ve worn that doesn’t feel greasy or heavy on my face. It’s light and glides easily on and no one can notice it. This is definitely a must try!

I know people are crazy about this one. I’m not sure yet. It’s only been a week. I’m not a daily makeup wearer, so not used to the feel of primer on my face everyday. This feels just like a primer. It’s got a very waxy texture to it. I’m constantly aware that I have a layer of product on my face. 
Of course, that it is colorless, means a great deal for someone like me who hates white caste and thick gooey sunscreens. But still... this feels more like makeup than skincare.

No more white cast sunscreen! Super lightweight and gentle for sensitive skin so you don’t get breakouts or overly dry or oily skin. Goes on super smooth and helps with getting a bit more hydrated skin.

I love the supergoop brand overall as they are Cruelty-Free so I was thrilled to try this sunscreen. It doesn’t disappoint! My face doesn’t get that white cast so many sunscreens leave and it feels so lightweight.  The spf of 40 is perfect for those needed a good level of protection for daily use.  The packaging with the yellow cap is cute as well.

use it every morning after applying all of my skincare and absolutely love it! out of my opinion it doesn't feel heavy, leave a film or anything but I wish it was a spf higher than 40 but was recommended by a esthetician after getting microneedling
Love this stuff! Super light weight and doesn’t leave any streaky residue on the skin! I also love the fact that it doesn’t have a sunscreen smell. Definitely will be repurchasing in the future.
Love that it is very lightweight and does not leave a white cast over your face.  You can easily apply make up over it.  I apply a moisturizer wait about 5-10 min. then apply the Unseen sunscreen.
I don’t recommend because it is a purely chemical sunscreen, not completely coral reef safe and makes me nervous to use chemicals over minerals.

Holy grail... I have tried everything from Cerave to expensive Murad SPF and they have all made my makeup separate and cake up. Finally gave the Unseen Sunscreen a try and it dries down matte, no pilling, no bad smell, no greasy feeling and the test was 5+ hrs later- NO SEPARATION! I took pictures in different lighting/angles (but no filters) to show how amazing it is. I have dry skin, 34 years old, wearing Too Faced Medium-Full Coverage Foundation (Nude) and Too Faced Sculpting Concealer (Snow). No primer as this SPF acts like a primer. No white cast, and it warms up almost like a putty/oil, but then absorbs so well into the skin and just melts. Feels like Smashbox dimethacone/silicon primer- but less greasy!
reviews.review_title: Doesn't cause makeup to break apart or cakey

reviews.review_text: The best sun screen I have ever used!!! There is absolutely no cast, feels so good on your skin. It makes my skin so soft and really does feel like a primer going on. I was very sceptic buying this product but I’m so happy I did. You literally need about a dime size of product so it’s going to last so the product pays for it’s self. But it if your tiered of that white cast on your face or that gross feeling most sun screens give. And spf 40 pshh... buy it!! I’m so happy I did!

I’m only docking a star because I don’t want to lead my acne-prone people on, otherwise it’s a nice product. Like others have mentioned, it has a silicon feel to it, which I usually don’t like, but I enjoyed that with this product because it made application easy and it didn’t cling to my dry patches. 

For acne-prone/sensitive people: this product may not work for you. I saw quite a few people say it didn’t make them break out. That wasn’t the case for me. I’m on Yaz birth control, .1% Tretinoin, and Duac (5% benzoyl peroxide/1% clindamycin) for my acne. I’ve had perfect skin for quite some time now, except this sunscreen gave me small red bumps on my chin, nose area, and forehead. My whole face was also very red at the end of the day, like I had a light sunburn. 

Again, it’s a nice product, but watch out if you’re sensitive. I’ve had great success with Clinique’s Pep Start tinted mineral sunscreen for a few years now, but I wanted a good sweat-proof one to layer with that because I’m so fair. I’m still on the hunt.
This is my favorite sunscreen fo my face. It feels so light and dries quickly. And it doesn’t bother my sensitive skin at all.
Doesn’t leave a white cast, feels like a primer. Never pills on skin, it’s great.
Its very light & feels very mush like a primer. But did not work for my super oily skin. It just felt like it made me even greasier.

If you don't mind that silicone feel, this sunscreen would be totally fine. I personally don't like how the sunscreen feels on my face, and it burns every time it gets in my eyes if I am sweating. I know a little can go a long way because if you put too much, it can feel goopy, but overall, I wasn't satisfied with this product.

I have silly sensitive dry skin. Think shedding lizard if the lizard flushed from fair to red. Anything can set my skin off. Too cold, too hot, walk past an olive tree... anything. Then I developed a sun sensitivity. I don’t even have to be in the sun. Just open my door under the shade of my porch when the sun is out and BOOM! I’m as red as a baboons behind. All sunscreens (except It’sCosmetics Bye Bye Foundation SPF 45, but I don’t like covering my skin. It feels like nothing on, when applied with a light hand and when I take it off my skin isn’t red. But I don’t always want foundation.) break me out, burn, give me white caste, settle in my fine lines, are greasy or just don’t work. Except this stuff! Like... OMG! YES! My skin does get very lightly red, BUT it is not much and you can’t feel this when it goes on. Once it dries I just feel soft skin and nothing else. I can apply it every 2 hours (and unlike my It’sCosmetics Bye Bye Foundation...) it doesn’t show or get too layered. No cracking or disintegrating. No harsh smell and soft going on too. I enjoy applying it! (Faints in shock.)

I do put a moisturizer on first as I have shedding lizard dry skin. With this sunscreen my skin looks great on camera... I look airbrushed. It’s mind blowing. I had a friend ask if I had gotten microdermabrasion... not in over a year!

Only 2 negatives and they are petty compared to the heck I have with other products. 1. It’s a little bit drying for me. If you have normal or oily skin this will be perfect. Even great for normal dry as opposed to my super dry skin.

I have tried this lines other sunscreens. The mineral one left a caste and felt a little thick. Play smelled a little to me and made my skin uncomfortable. The stuff in the tin was very emollient, but greasy. This one seems to be the perfect formula and it’s a gel. I didn’t believe it was sunscreen at first. I might try the vitamin C mixed with this product they just came out with. I’m very excited.
Love this product! Feels amazing on the skin and offers great protection

OMG! This is the best sunscreen EVER! First of all it's transparent, not white, and it's so silky and smooth! It feels very light and doesn't give me acne on the neck, like other sunscreens i've tried.

I was having terrible trouble with my skin - massive clogged pores, excessive oil, irritation and itchiness - and after removing Supergoop products (I tried this and the SPF moisturizer) from my routine, I discovered that they were the culprit. I do not recommend this sunscreen for sensitive skin, or really at all. I also found that this made my makeup look terrible, and I would get frequent sunburn despite using it as instructed. I gave this product many chances, but it simply didn't work for me.
love!! it has a slight silicone feel when you first apply it but it dries down matte! It doesn’t get greasy or oil throughout the day. A little goes a long way!
My favorite sunscreen. So light and airy in texture. Feels like nothing on the skin and doesnt interfere with makeup application on top.

I really wanted to like this sunscreen but unfortunately my sensitive skin couldn't handle it. I broke out a lot and still powered through. After 3 weeks I gave up. I know a lot of people like this product and if it didn't break me out, I would too! It just didn't work for my sensitive acne prone skin.

I am so glad this was just a 100 point sample and I didn’t pay full price. It just sat on top of my skin. It felt dirty and slippery/slimy all day. My foundation wore off so quickly too. I gave it a few days and then pitched the sample. Thank goodness for samples!
Honestly makes me excited to put on sunscreen. Goes on just like a primer
I feel like I’m putting an oil on my skin . I hate how it feel. So Greasy !!! I will return this

I love Supergoop products. They work really well for me and my lifestyle. I'm 36 and don't enjoy putting a lot of makeup on daily. I love this combo. Unseen sunscreen+Glow screen. Gives a perfect tinted moisturizer look. ALso, if you feel a little too shiny on somedays after you apply it. Just dab with a sponge or some powder.

My absolute FAVORITE sunscreen! It helps give my skin a nice subtle glow and doesn’t get greasy. I tried another “gel like” formula and it sucked. This is the best, I wish they’d bring back the larger size again.

Absolutely the best sunscreen for my face, neck, and chest! It's a very different texture than any other sunscreen I've encountered - like a gel but very light. It doesn't irritate my skin or cause breakouts like other sunscreens tend to do.
Great dupe for Murad invisiblur! I got this as a sample and was pleasantly surprised with the velvety texture and worked great as a primer!
I like it because it dries matte and leaves no white cast on my brown skin.

Best sunscreen for your face I have tried thus far! What I like the most is it works so well under foundation!! I couldn’t even believe how well it worked and the consistency is a light smooth gel like. 2 thumbs up for me!

Literally nothing bad to say here. This SPF is amazing. I am a brown skinned woman. I love that this leaves no white cast. What I love the most is how light weight it is. SPF is so important when trying to lighten hyperpigmentation. I use it everyday and I’m having more luck lightening my scars. 4 stars cause it’s a bit pricey. But I’ll continue to buy hahaha.

4.5 stars
